39278877.review:
Crazy air combo along with roman cancels makes every battle look like top 10 anime battles accompanied by a rocking soundtrack. 
Online has Steamworks Integration for easier matchmaking with friends. 
Training mode online and skippable win animation so you and your opponent can keep on fighting without wasting time watching the same winners cutscene over and over. 
Fantastic tutorial mode that teaches newcomers to fighting game basics of neutral, pressure, hit confirming, whiff punishing, anti airing, and more. 
Helpful combo trials that even has sample button inputs to show you the button press timing. Plenty of these combos are useful in real match too. 
Netcode is delay based. While others may have problem with it, I find the cancel/gatling nature of the combo system here undisturbed since you just need to watch for the attack to hit before canceling with the next attack. 

Never got into Guilty Gear until Rev2, even newcomer like me got hooked. This is the best fighting game ever.

39264967.review:
Guilty Gear - великая серия файтингов, живущая уже 20 лет.
Я долго думал, как бы написать обзор на нее как можно адекватнее и без субъективных суждений, но так и не смог этого сделать, потому что как и любой другой великий игровой проект, Guilty Gear - это нечто гораздо большее, чем просто игра, это стиль жизни. И, судя по количеству знающих о ней людей, да и играющих в нее, он подойдет далеко не всем.

Каждый из столпов, на которых строится GG, одновременно и повод для того, чтобы в нее влюбиться, и повод, чтобы ее возненавидеть:

1. "Тяжелый" саундтрек
2. Графический стиль

...и самое главное...

3. Высокий потолок скилла

Если по первым пунктам все понятно из трейлера, то по третьему нужно уточнить. GG - это как  [spoiler]господи, прости[/spoiler] Dark Souls мира файтингов. В каждый момент времени, ты можешь осознать, что весь тот прогресс, которого ты достиг, это лишь малая толика того, что может тебе дать игра.
Изучил мувлисты и освоил хитбоксы? Ты уже на голову выше всех новоприбывших.
Понял как связывать некоторые удары в комбо? Поздравляю, больше твои друзья с тобой в версус не сядут, потому что им кажется, что против тебя играть невозможно.

Тут ты суешься в онлайн, и тебя раскатывает всухую первый попавшийся в руме чувак.

Сотни часов спустя ты узнаешь о таких вещах как Roman Cancel'ы, Faultless Defense, Hellfire, и целой куче чего еще.
Узнаешь постепенно, потому что сразу не получится при всем желании. С каждой новой фишкой, ты видишь все больше тактик, понимаешь, насколько много свободы предлагает тебе эта игра. Десятки способов сломать защиту вражеского бойца, куча защитных и атакующих опций - все, что казалось сначала попросту невозможным, станет не сложнее, чем дышать. Твои пальцы начнуть парить по кнопкам, и ты будешь отыгрывать матч за матчем без сил остановиться.

В этом весь Guilty Gear. Был, есть, и (надеюсь) таким и будет. Маленький райский островок для тех, кто готов потратить время прежде чем полностью освоится в боевой механике. Игра, отдавшись которой, ты вряд ли сможешь воспринимать другие, более прямолинейные файтинги [spoiler]Street Fighter, например[/spoiler]. 

При всем вышесказанном, GG остается довольно дружелюбной игрой по отношению к новичкам, или казуалам. В локальных матчах можно установить гандикап (фору), чтобы отбалансировать разницу в навыке между игроками. Если и этого недостаточно, более сильный игрок может навесить на себя лаг в несколько фреймов.
При нежелании вникать в построение комбо и спешлы, можно выбрать Stylish раскладку и наслаждаться автоматическими комбо, динамикой на экране и оффлайновыми режимами.
Весь хардкор проявляется ТОЛЬКО в онлайне, ну или если у тебя есть ИРЛ матерые друзья-ггшники.

Как и говорил, я не могу расписать Guilty Gear со стороны и объективно. При всем желании это сделать, получится не обзор, а признание в любви к ней, как это в итоге и вышло. И если почитать список положительных отзывов, то можно понять, что так получилось не только у меня. Но если тебе, читатель, все-таки хочется немного объективности, задумайся, может ли плохая игра получать такие признания?

39108042.review:
Despite my low hours of play time, I have put a decent amount of time into GG Xrd -Sign- the game before this.

And I this is with the Rev 2 upgrade

The best way I can describe GGXrd Rev is that while yes the game has a very high skill ceiling, it also very easy to get into the game and learn how to play it. The tutorial this game has is one of the best in all of fighting games, being treated almost like a minigame as it gets you to adapt to how to read the games inputs and learn its mechanics. After that it will go into the advanced mechanics 

Now we have the main modes. For offline you have Episodic which is your traditional Arcade mode, going through about 8 to 9 stages with each character having a different story in it. Versus is your Offline fighting mode, for 1v1 or 1vAI and ability to pick characters. M.O.M. is an RPG survival mode where your fighting the same cast of 23, with various stats and gear items. For instance you can even equip moves by other characters in your loadout. Personally I do miss the GGXrd Sign map but dam that map was REALLY grindy. And for those looking for a good single player challenge, MOM will do its best to test your skills. Lastly is the Dojo which has your training modes that will go and show you everything this game has to offer.

Story is more along the lines of a visual novel, so its great to learn the story and lore. Also is very rewarding 50k W$ (the games currency) which can be used to help unlock Raven (200k W$).

Okay as far as multiplayer, you do have your ranked and unranked along with a small lobby. But the kicker is that the PC community is rather small, sitting alltime peak of 1300 players and normaly sits around 500 daily(steam charts). I dont know the PS4 player count, but Arc Sys tends to do a lot better on those platforms. Not that its going to be impossible to find a match, but be on the look out for discords and other LFG communities to help find players.

Overall this is a great fighting game to get into and while its content is vast, deep and complex, this game will show you how to 'git gud' with all of its mechanics. GG Xrd didn't dumb its self down for new commers like SFV, it gave those new commers the tools they need to get better. Almost forgot, the sound track is god teir and keeps you pumped. The themes fow Leo and Slayer are my personally favs

39025630.review:
GUILTY GEAR Xrd -REVELATOR- is, in short, a fluid and fantastic fighting game that is easy to learn but hard to master. The game is very accessible to new players and boasts a ton of replay value with plenty of characters to learn and collectibles to earn. I would definitely recommend this game to people who are looking to get into fighting games or are just looking for a good fighting game to sink their teeth into.




To go a bit more in depth, starting off with characters, all of them are unique in their own style, whether it be look, personality, or playstyle. No two characters play the same, each with their own unique styles of play and gimmicks which allow each character to provide a different experience for old and new players. The characters are all very balanced, with one character not really being objectively "better" than another, due to the fact that it's not really about which character is "better" overall, but about matchups between two characters, as a character could be really bad at fighting one character, but would matchup really well with another.

The gameplay has been fine tuned to near perfection when it comes to fast and fluid fighting game goodness. Although it may be a bit rough at first to learn the button layout, once you learn it becomes easy to learn new moves and combos for each character. Through combinations of punches, kicks, and slashes you can perform either short or long combos to really keep your opponent guessing. Learning what moves can chain or cancel into others and what matchups work can really help in getting better at the game.

The art style and look of the game is where Guilty Gear Xrd -Revelator- really shines above all the other fighting games. By using cell shaded 3D animation the team behind Xrd was able to capture a style that looks exactly like something straight out of an anime, but with 3D models. All the characters are crafted beautifully with hyper detailed model work and animation that keeps the snappy look of regular sprite based fighting games but with a very nice hand drawn-esque twist to really bring out the best in a fighting game's look. The environments are no exception, with stunning detail going into the backgrounds, all locations being unique and beautiful in their own right.

And obviously, the highlight of any fighting game, the online play. The online for Guilty Gear Xrd -Revelator- is much improved from -SIGN- with the frame delay being very accurate and the game being able to maintain smooth gameplay. Note: however, while the online can be really good, I would strongly recommend trying to stick to local play for those with non-stable internet connections, as the frame delay and frame rate drops dramatically with bad connections on PC.

As stated before, this is a great, high quality fighting game for the price point and anyone who wants to get into fighting games or is looking for a great fighting game, and I would strongly recommend picking this up for those looking for a great time.


Note: If you haven't heard this already, I would strongly recommend getting the "GUILTY GEAR Xrd -REVELATOR- (+DLC Characters) + REV 2 All-in-One" for the definitive and best version of Guilty Gear Xrd -Revelator- as the Rev 2 DLC improves online and adds a lot more content to the base game.

38851808.review:
The best game out there if you are an action anime fan. Period.

[h1]Main Pros : [/h1]
[list]
 [*] It mastered a new level of cell shading and rendering, creating a style that can seduce even the biggest 2D lovers (like myself)

 [*] The game mechanics push the boundaries of fighting games even further than usual, with crazy systems that remain balanced.

 [*] Has one of the most advanced practice modes in the world, which actually teach you what a "2D" fighter is about, as well as specific matchup tips (as in : here is a tip to beat character X which is giving you problems)

 [*] The world and characters are 200% anime, with a lot of flamboyant and exaggerated personnalities, as well as crazy and memorable visual designs. All of those are a lot of fun, especially if you are into anime style.

 [*] A system of loot allows you to unlock images, musics, and "digital figures", which are pretty much a way to enjoy and customize the 3D models for display in a gallery mode. 

 [*] All loot items are cosmetic or extras : they do not affect balace or the gameplay of the main game. You are also guaranteed to eventually get all of the loot within a reasonable timeframe of about 100 hours. No real money microtransactions.

 [*] Multiplayer is pretty well made with its simulated arcade rooms, and the frame-delay netcode used for compensating lag quite good 

 [*] There is usually a multiplayer room for unranked matches opened at all times.

 [*] It has Dizzy, the greatest character ever, in it (shut up, my inner fanboy!)
[/list]

[h1]Main Cons (yeah, there are a few) : [/h1]
[*] Ranked matches are almost completely deserted, making it pretty much impossible  to rank up and get most of the "badges" (achievements). Fortunately the badges don't unlock things besides pride.

[*] Single player modes are slightly limited. You can play a pseudo RPG in "MOM mode", which allows you to keep grinding towards something (even when you have unlocked all the loot)... but the grind is specific to this mode, and nobody plays it online.

[*] Dragon Ball Fighter Z will overshadow this game when it releases : it will use the same graphic style, but it already has the power of a nostalgic licence. This will pretty much suck people out of the GG franchise, which is a shame.

38844161.review:
Yes it's a great game, sure it looks absolutely gorgeous, it's well optimized and it does have an awesome soundtrack by Daisuke ishiwatari. And of course I have to mention it's innovative tutorial, meaty story mode that will appeal to anime and visual novel fans, how well balanced the various fighters are despite their diverse fighting styles and the sheer amount of charm and style all of those characters have. But I have to bring up one important thing that I don't see in ANY of the top reviews. Something that I think that YOU, the consumer deserve to have somebody tell you about ahead of time. Simply put, this game is jam-packed with waifus. We got your light waifus, we got your dark waifus, we got your good waifus, we got your evil waifus. We got your samurai waifus, we've got your literal waifu waifus, we've got waifus who do kung-fu cookery and we've got waifus who put the bottom in bellbottoms.

And ladies, (and some of you gentlemen) if waifus are not your thing do not fret, because we just might have a husbando for you. Maybe you're into cool rebellious types? Kind hearted pretty boys? Sauve, older vampire types? Or bald, screaming dudes carrying giant scalpels, wearing bags on their heads?... Never mind Faust actually. Or that's what I would say, if he weren't... *a doctor*.

So remember, in purchasing this game you're not just receiving a masterfully crafted fighting game and supporting triple A development that doesn't nickel and dime you to death with meaningless microtransactions, you're also supporting one of the finest waifu production houses on the planet.

38758249.review:
easily the best japanese fighter on the market to date. every aspect is on par with, if not better than, all of its competitors. the graphics look fantastic, the cleanest looking fighter/game out right now. the pure amount of finesse used to make the 3d models look exactly like 2d animations is incredbile. the combat feels smooth and fluid. training with all of the characters that interested me was a joy. the training mode makes combos simple to understand but difficult to master and pull off in an actual match, which felt rewarding to those who decide to put in the time. the "roman cancel" system also helps bring the combat to a new level that speeds up the flow of battle the gives more options to all players. all of this is easily accessable with possibly the best tutorial ever offered in a fighting game. i don't have much to say about the tutorial other than to play it for yourself. the character designs are amazing. the redesigns of old and the designs of new characters are both equally great. the online felt passable when both players had good connection, and most/all of the music was phenomenal.

tl;dr: great weeb fighter
5/5

38712612.review:
Not gonna lie, got it to practice for Dragon Ball: FighterZ. However, I ended up having more fun than I thought I would! Arc System Works put a lot of love into this game, and it shows in the overall quality. Surprised that this game is not as popular as it should be.

[b]Like[/b]
+ Gorgeous anime-style graphics: excellent character animation and nice backgrounds.
+ Interesting (and over-the-top) characters. I had to try all of them, and I'm glad to report that they felt balanced, and their playstyles are pretty unique.
+ Decent story mode, which plays out like a visual novel
+ Deep combat system with nice ultimates. Incredibly satisfying to learn the mechanics, let alone master.
+ One of the best tutorials ever seen in a fighting game. Close to what I saw on the new Killer Instinct.
+ Cool soundtrack

[b]Dislike[/b]
- Not many playing online. To find someone, I suggest getting REV2 upgrade, and doing player matches. That's what others suggested, and it works for me.
- Even if you get "REV2 upgrade + All DLCs bundle", you are still required to buy characters with real money like Dizzy and Haehyun, if you want them. Sucks.
- Story cutscenes play in some weird framerate. Animations in there look slow also. Not sure if it was intended. Action scenes during the cutscenes does not have this oddity.
- Nitpick: the extra costumes are just color swaps

38667752.review:
Don't let the low amount of play time mislead you, I played Guilty Gear Xrd Rev2 a lot on PlayStation 4. The reason why I also own this on PC is because I think it's easily the best fighting game out there. Don't get me wrong, I'm still a scrub and online I lose most of the time. Still, I think this game taught me more about fighting games than Street Fighter ever did before. 

Guilty Gear might be one of the most complex fighting games in existence, but I've enjoyed my time with it a lot more than with Street Fighter V. Which is a nice game as well, Guilty Gear Xrd just appeals a lot more to me. The graphics are, after countless hours of play, still amazing to look at. The soundtrack is great if you like rock and metal (and who doesn't like to sing along with Birthday Train?). The story, I don't understand any of it, but it's great to dive into if you have the persistence. 

But the characters are what stands out the most to me. Most of these have been tweaked and improved for more than twenty years. Yeah, it's all anime, but it's great anime. Anime done right and I love it. All of the characters have their own traits and play very different from each other. It's proof of Arc System Works craftsmanship that these characters are balanced so well. Sure, there is a tier list, but a good player can still do a lot of damage with a low tier character. It might only matter in truly high level gameplay, something you shouldn't worry about if you never played Guilty Gear before.

The thing I dislike is the low popularity of this game. Since this title has been out for a while there is a small group of high level die-hard players always playing online. For a new player this could become a frustrating experience. Sure, everyone is nice enough most of the time, but I doubt you'll learn anything if the difference of skill is too big. Also due to the small amount of players nobody in the US and Europe plays ranked matches (while Japan still does). It's all player rooms, which is designed really well by Arc System Works (and will be used in a similar way for Dragon Ball Fighters), but it's sometimes hard to find a proper room or someone to play with.

Before I forget, for new players the game should be very interesting, because it basically has multiple tutorials where it teaches you how to play a fighting game. It really is something no other Japanese fighting game did before (Killer Instinct also has a great tutorial) and it truly teaches you techniques from low level to high level stuff. You can't blame the developers for trying to get new blood on board of the (Birthday) train.

All in all, just get Guilty Gear Xrd Revelator with the Rev2 DLC if you want to dive into a fighting game. Beginner or expert. I'm sure there are a lot of SFV players who are looking for something with more depth to chew on. This game is what you should get.

38645368.review:
一百多RMB你能买到啥？！4小时以上的日番+所有人物的数码手办，何况还附送EVO格斗大作！！！！（笑）
~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~
游戏体验级佳，开发商业界清流，没氪金模式，除了DLC，没额外的人民币皮肤内购（你们可以对比下C社某5），各种良心的一笔，已成这游戏死忠，下个DLC什么时候出？快把我的钱拿走！！！！
~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~
官方中文非常认真，绝非机翻，点赞！
~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~
教程模式我给一万分！！！刚买到手，想试试于是打开了练习模式。然后。。。第一次玩就沉浸了4小时欲罢不能。说实话有点后悔为啥这么晚才买这游戏。
~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~
库里有N社某7，C社某5的本人表示，如果这游戏的教程是100分的话，某5的教程30分，某7教程也就勉强及格。这游戏的教程是我目前在所有格斗游戏里见过的最最最完善（你听的没错，是最最最完善！）的教学引导系统。整个教程循序渐进，逐步引导玩家一点点通过各种挑战，而且练习时很有乐趣。前期对着游戏的各种疑问都可以通过手柄y键得到解答是最骚的（练习模式里屏幕上的出招演示系统绝壁要给无数个666，各种招数用轨迹的方式演示，摇杆和按钮要在什么时候按和向什么方向按都清晰无比，仔细多看几遍，依葫芦画瓢就可以少走一万条弯路。），开发组准备的答案讲解的也非常详细。教学后期可以对各个英雄的特点进行针对练习。教程整体细致的简直叫人感动的流泪（而C社的某五代的教程是无奈的眼泪。某5的挑战模式里很多连招时机都要自行领悟，按键时机完全没有任何提示，本来这年头玩FTG的人就少，某五你还这么玩是嫌这类型还死的不够快吗？（滑稽））
~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~
数字手办模式！这就是我最初的入坑原因。所有人物手办都可以在游戏里打出来，在这模式下可以360度旋转放大缩小，换装换姿势换表情换背景去UI，各种随便拍，开发商甚至做了一个模拟相机的UI！！！细节令人感动（所有这些要用游戏币买的，不过这游戏绝无内购，都要辛苦打出来）妹子萌汉子酷，各种角度欣赏这游戏的人设，简直没挑！！！！！！！
~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~
游戏里的钓装备类似于开箱系统可以开出各种饰品皮肤，反正我是打算刷刷刷了。
~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~
其他模式没细玩，不过感觉单机模式很充实，有种类似RPG模式，可以装备系统换装什么的。（3D就是这点好）
~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~
剧情模式4小时以上。。。嗯。。。闲下来看看番也不错
~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~
其他优点很多评测都提了很多，这里就不多提了，对比市面上的其他格斗游戏，这游戏连续技出招比较轻松，出招时机判定比较宽松，攻击判定很明确，打击感非常非常好。玩起来很愉快不会有太大压力。除了通常类型，一键出招模式明显是为了轻度玩家设计的。不过高手之间打起来还是眼花缭乱。属于起点低上限高的那种。
~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~
联机场地实体化这方面做的很有意思，玩家可以作为一个萌系小人身临其境的在各个联机大厅或自建房来回走动。排位不敢去，大厅联机的人挺少的，不过自建房的人不少，随便一刷就能刷出十几个房间。不过里面的基本上都是大触对掐，新人如我，在这种对战房里只能划划水观观战踢踢球玩玩练习模式什么的做条咸鱼就好（笑）。
~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~
友情提示1：本文提到的N社和C社，和Namco和capcom强行没有任何关系（手动滑稽）
友情提示2：这游戏选项里默认的声音太大了！！！不调的话感觉我耳朵要聋了，在游戏设置里调成60感觉还是有点大。
~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~
最后：REV2里的梅姐好萌！！！！梅姐就是赞！梅姐万岁！！！

38645088.review:
First off, let's get right to it. The netcode is terrific. Me and my buddy can play for a good while and it won't hiccup or lag once. If that's the redemption factor for you when it comes to fighters, you're in luck with this game.

The game itself is a gem. Artwork and animations is phenomenal, combat and gameplay mechanics don't leave anything to complain about, character selection is just about what you'd expect from a fighter (well, a quality fighter. (looking at you, SFV) My only complaint is that there's not much variety of modes but maybe it's because I feel Injustice 2 set the bar very high for me. The tutorial and the dojo missions are terrific to play and learn. The best part of the dojo is that you can use what you learned in player-vs-player combat. 

I have the Rev 2 upgrade also. I don't think it is a standalone game like on PS4, so make a note of that. Also, my buddy does not have Rev 2 but you can play together if the person with the base game sends the Steam invite.

I am fully satisfied with my purchase of this game and all the DLC. I thought it was worth it. Arc SystemWorks can make damn good fighters. If you see this game on sale and you've been eyeing it for a while, and you enjoy quality fighters, you can't go wrong with this.

38602142.review:
Самый плохой пример игрового опыта который можно испытать. Guilty Gear по своей структуре явно не создавалась для игры людьми. Игровой процесс доставляет чистую боль и желание вернуть потраченные на игру деньги, но увы нельзя уже... Разъясню все по полочкам.
Механика - Не для кого ни секрет, что файтинги требуют от игрока реакции, расчетливости и знаний, а так же тонну практики. Это свойственно почти для всех соревновательных игр, но только не для этой. Главная проблема это полное отсутствие динамики. Так как персонажи сделаны в 3D смотреть на движения в которых экономили на фреймах не просто отвратительно, но и жутко неудобно. Никакая реакция не поможет тебе увидеть атаку которая имеет 3-4 фрейма, а так же в некоторых случаях отсутствие замаха. Из-за этого создается картина, что игра очень дерганая либо постоянно микрофризит, но нет это ее нормальное состояние. Ни один 2D файтинг за мою карьеру не страдал чем-то подобным, только тут в серии которая существет не первое пятилетие, узкоглазики решили экономить на всем. Заставки? Либо ноль анимации, либо она на уровне Масс эфект андромеда или игр прямиком из 2008 года, а сам бой чистой воды моча, рассмотреть что-либо невозможно. К этому так же добавляем чрезмерное количество ненужных бликов всплесков и прочего инфернального дерьма на экране при выполнении любого действия. Такой треш свойственен всем азиатским играм, поэтому я привык к подобному, но тут учитывая дерганную анимацию и кучи ненужных эфектов происходящих на экране хоть как-то реагировать на происходящие становится сложно, а для кого-то попросту невозможно.
 Управление - Казалось бы выносить это как нечто отдельное не имеет смысла и во всех файтингах принцип управления один... Да... Я так тоже думал, но GG на аркадном джойстике вертел этот довод. Игра совершенно не оптимизирована для игры на геймпаде белого человека. В чем причина? Все просто! Начну с того, что часть движений на крестовине джойстика от XBox 360 и XBox 1 S не регистрируется. Проблема в том, что при последовательном нажатии ↓→ игра регистрирует не движение на 90градусов, а диагональ, для нормальных файтингов это не проблема (Сам проверял) Но GG отказывается в подобном случае проводить приемы на некоторых персонажах, про использовании спец приемов и речи быть не может, ведь те требуют ровного поворота на 180 градусов. На джойстике от PS4 все шло 60 на 40, то регистрирует как надо, то по диагонали. В этом случае я подключил "Mad Catz Fightpad Pro" С этой крестовиной все заработало как надо. Если играть на стике, то попросту не хватает скорости его движения, из этого делаем вывод, что играть на геймпаде не специализирующемся на файтинах все равно что сесть на 2 стула с пиками и Guilty Gear'ом. Покупаем или собираем аркадник, джентльмены, а иначе кукиш, а не удовольствие от игры.
 Соединение и онлайн - В GG при игре с оппонентом использующим вай фай из макдональдса, вместо телепортаций по арене, разработчики решили сделать различия по фреймам, насколько это тупая идея я говорить не берусь. Что телепортирующиеся оппоненты, что потери по 20 фреймов - все Эскобар. Но если учесть что фреймов в самой анимации не так уж и много и динамики в игре нет, среднее или ниже подключение непригодны для игры, иначе невозможно понять что делает противник. Онлайн на ПК естественно мертв, поэтому я попробовал на плойке, найти людей с нормальным подключение можно, но это долго, действительно долго.
 Субъективщина - Я считаю Guilty Gear Необоснованно сложной игрой. Ряд имеющихся механик в частности комбо система технически не выполнимы. Мало того, что ряд приемов требует действительно неудобного движения на 180 градусов и дополнительных нажатий по таймингам, а я повторюсь в игре где механики атаки видный словно слайд шоу таймить по анимации сверх сложно и неудобно. Так при всем при этом на то чтобы их выучить уходит куча времени. Я потратил примерно 14 часов на изучение комбо. Пошел в онлайн и... Естественно ничего не смог сделать, ибо мой оппонент задавил меня спамом атак. Спам это вообще отдельная тема. В GG нет ни нормального парирования или смещения как в Tekken, а количество атак после которых можно контратаковать сведено к минимуму, так еще и блок не сбивает комбо, гениально! В результате победит тот, кто атакует более активно, а не тот у кого есть мозг. Теперь я понимаю почему Guilty Gear не является популярной игрой в своем жанре, ребятам стоило лишь сделать чуть более удобную систему управления для геймпадов (Ало, уже, блять, 2018 год, неужели так тяжело догадаться, что не все заинтересованы играть на аркадниках? Ах да, игру же японцы делали...) и добавить больше динамики и плавности картинки, а еще сделать боевую систему более РЕЛЕВАНТНОЙ (нахуй в этой игре такая штука как Jump canceling? Правильно - иди нахуй, сам игры нормальные делай и тогда говори!) и вот она! Идеальная игра! А хотя нет, сюжет тот еще идиотизм. Из-за того, что у меня много свободного времени я его прошел... Не то чтобы плохо, но и не хорошо, лор игры интересный, но события показанные игроку та еще аниме идиотия. А режиссура на уровне российских комедий в тандеме с бессмыслеными и пустыми диалогами, полностью сливают стори мод как таковой. Персонажи - все они уникальны как в визуальном плане, так и в плане характеров, а вот играть за них... Ну такое себе, В игре всего лишь 6 героев с отличными от остальных механиками (Механиками, а не очередью нажатия кнопок для комбо), лично для своего стиля игры я персонажа не нашел. Ровно так же как и смысла для себя дальше тратить время на игру. Причина проста. Учиться игра слишком муторно и долго, а сам игровой процесс удовольствия не приносит, а если и приносит, то совсем уж минимальное.
 Пишу это ревью, чтобы люди под первым впечатлением не дали себя обмануть и не попали в это смердящее болото японских файтингов. Запомните, деньги за игру можно вернуть если не наиграл более 2 часов.
 Хомяки набившие свои щечки калом скорее всего скажут, что я тот еще ебобо и в игре не разобрался, их право, я не виню тупость других людей, но ТЫ человек еще не познавший всего этого путешествия в файтинги, напоминающими только если прогулку по зеленой миле в один конец, ТЫ не должен страдать как я, повернись назад и иди играть в хорошие игры пока не поздно!

38549503.review:
En los aspectos de presentación, gráficos, música, diseño y contenido, GGXrd Rev2 es una joya, tiene marcado su estilo, siendo todo de una u otra manera una referencia a la música Rock/Metal.

Para narrar su historia el juego no elige entre historia jugable y cinematográfica, te da los dos. Siendo el Episode mode la parte jugable que se centra en cada personaje antes de el modo historia, Si bien el ultimo es prácticamente una película anime, es entretenida y una opción cuando uno termina de dar golpes y sablazos en los otros modos.

La jugabilidad tiene profundidad y variedad de mecánicas bien definidos, ninguna se siente que está demás. Sus personajes son únicos en diseño y estilos, siendo este uno de sus puntos fuertes, todo personaje es diferente uno del otro, aún teniendo mecánicas y conceptos universales en el juego.

Si bien su jugabilidad puede parecer  muy compleja y abrumadora a primera vista, el juego presenta modos de entrenamiento que explican y enseñan el juego y sus mecánicas de manera eficaz y detallada.

En resumen, GGXRD es un paquete completo y de calidad que ningun fan de juegos de peleas debería dejar pasar.

38520160.review:
[h1]This game is like a hidden treasure that I'm glad I rediscovered.[/h1]
[b]Best Anime game available.[/b] Great art and animation, good music and entertainting story. I wish other anime games had such refined artwork and presentation.

There are plenty of more technical reviews about the awesomeness of the combat and all that. I'm casual so I'll just focus on experience.

The colors pop nicely, the controls are resonspive, characters expressive, modes of gameplay are deep. There are plenty of things to do in this game if you choose, all while looking very nice and setting a standard other games fail to meet (frankly highly rated 3D anime TV and movies fail to meet these standards, for shame!)

Many 3D (anime) movies and TV shows are very inhuman, stiff and lacking personality. Guilty Gear is not this. They actually use 3D to make thier characters and concepts more detailed and articulated than their 2D predecessors. They do surpass the early 2000's versions of their game in that area for sure. While you will still see polygons, its nowhere as bad as the vast majority of games that go with the 3D "anime" styling, this isn't some cheap attempt. This wasn't done on a budget. (well it probably was, but much better than all the other games in my library...)

I loved the old Dreamcast Guilty Gear. However many of the later games bothered me for one reason or another. I own the PS4 version of Guilty Gear Xrd. The crummy frame rate during cutscenes and certain skills made me too uneasy to play. While there are still issues with PC version, (even while the the PC version is 60fps rock-solid all times) I can now clearly see its not a hardware issue but a data/direction issue. Like much anime (including 3D anime), they do 15 fps sequences, even when the art is 3D. This makes the visuals jarring at times. 

The gameplay itself is a solid and clean 60fps. Each frame is animated properly. So you won't be distracted at the most important times. 

I have no intention of being competitive, I just want to play for lore and all GG games have been rich in that area. So even a single player, that just wants to mash buttons and see good visuals will have something to enjoy. There are plenty of things to unlock, music, colors and some diarama mode.

When I first played the PS4 version "Story" Mod I didn't understand why it wasn't interactive. Years later I find its meant to be your true Anime/Visual novel mode that you play while eating lunch/snacks! So I plan to actually watch it through this time! easier to do on my PC since I'm sorta glued to it.

38385362.review:
So much eye candy.

Really, the thing that's the most striking was their attempt - and success - at making 3D work look like 2D animation. While anime isn't everybody's cuppa, their hard work at doing hand-adjusted animation and "inbetween" models really makes it stand out from the crowd. It's easily the best-looking fighting game in my opinion, if not one of the best looking games in general. They avoid the tendency for costume and character overdesign you see in other series, but the level of detail in outfits is striking, from little rivets to even tiny bits of text you can only spot during certain animations. It really is something else.

"But how is the game?" Well, it's a very refined high-mobility 2D fighting game that sticks to its roots, largely for good and to a lesser extent for worse. Characters have fast, big, and creative attacks, a wide variety of strategies and strengths, and are loaded with personality and visual flair. There are several ways to try and turn games around, from increased damage on supers at low life to "bursts" that knock enemies away. However, if you're not into doing half-circles followed by a direction reversal, you might find this more than a little intimidating. While it's not the worst old-school fighting game motions I've seen, there is the occassional 360 degree joystick motion or quarter-circle plus half-circle archaic notions that, unfortunately, keep games like Guilty Gear targeted squarely at their default audience. However, it does feature one of the best training modes in the genre, so if you're willing to dig in, the game will teach you some surprisingly pro techniques.

The story is pure word salad nonsense at this point, concluding the story from Guilty Gear Xrd #SIGN and the barely-played-by-anybody Guilty Gear X2 Overture. Having played the series since the original Guilty Gear game on the Playstation 1, I can only imagine what it would be like to come in at this point in the story. The arcade modes set up endings for each of the characters which plays into a straightforward anime movie / visual novel mode without any actual gameplay. And while it's pretty (and the story is enjoyable for those already invested in it), I wish they had come up with a way to engage the player better. Still, it is very, very easy on the eyes. And the soundtrack is an an amazing collection of hard rock, albeit with some questionable english lyrics at times...

While it doesn't really push the fighting genre forward at all game-play wise, Guilty Gear Xrd #REVELATOR is an extremely refined and tuned entry in the series. It's nearly the Platonic ideal of what it strives to be. If you like anime or metal and you like fighting games, get on top of this. It isn't going to change videogames, but it's a great entry in an already very original and memorable series.

Played through every character on arcade mode to completion and went through the story. Did a little online play, but not much. I'm only "good casual" or "low pro" at this sort of game, so take that into account, get gooders.

38058161.review:
Flowchart tl;dr recommendation:

-Fast and fluid high-paced gameplay.
-Decent amount of offline content and unlockables.
-Surprisingly good tutorials and missions to get at least started.
-Steep learning curve.
-Multiplayer activity is heavily region specific and\or reliant to local communities.

Note: If you are looking for the latest version of Revelator, you need the All-In-One Rev+Rev2 package. If you already own Revelator, you simply need Rev2 DLC.

(Begin walloftext)

Guilty Gear is a long running 2D fighting game dating originally back to 1998. I can only speculate it began when someone watched too much shonen anime while playing wildly mistuned guitar in a garage and decided to put them both in a blender and I dare to say some folk may have encountered the name purely due to its pretty rocking soundtrack. It is perhaps the first (?) example of a fighting game where air is equally common place to duke it out as the ground due air mobility, leading to a common term "airdasher" to describe Guilty Gear and some other anime-style fighting games as well. Another notable aspect is how basic combo structure is more lenient than in several other entries combined, which on very basic level makes it easier to pick up and play without need to read a fighter jet manual how to combo several attacks. It boomerangs back later in another form however.

Like in any other fighting game, the purpose is to beat the living crap out of the opponent before the same happens to yourself. Aforementioned airdashing adds another element to it as the to the casual observer, the gameplay often appears as if two angry bees trying to hit eachother. Each character has their own moveset of normal moves and special moves, and some have unique movement options or even restrictions as well: someone has teleport dash instead of regular ground dash, someone has no real ground dash but it instead functions as air-hoverdash, one character cannot dash at all and so on. Characters' unique selling point often makes up a good part of their gameplan or tools of trade they can use. Mechanically the game provides good set of universal options, ranging from reducing chip damage and pushing the opponent back to blitz shielding to "parry" an attack essentially to simple "get off me" in form of a burst, to double jumps and instant kills - which are mostly used to either goof around or swag round-enders in certain conditions - and whatnot.

Perhaps most bizarrely (for the genre) the game actually has functional and understandable tutorial which teaches you plenty of basics how game works roughly, followed by plenty of missions where you can learn how some other characters work or prefer to use in without need to consult the fighter jet manual just yet. Multiplayer lobbies allow 8x players total playing on either four separate "cabinets" or lining up as they see fit, there is a training room so you can do a quick check of x or y before picking up a cabinet, spectate-only is possible and whatnot. Feature-wise quality of life Guilty Gear is a gold standard that should be put on a pedestral. For those who are more interested in offline content or unlocking something, there are unlockables in form of artwork, extra background music from older games or new tracks introduced in Xrd, voice actor messages, colour palettes for characters and whatnot. The main story of the game is more like a low-key anime OVA (if not outright visual novel minus naughty bits) and as far as the story goes, all I was able to decipher is that apparently in alternate universe Freddie Mercury was a scientific genius who also engineered some weapons of mass destruction with someone after magic appeared in the world and destroyed most of the ye olde tech, and then as expected something went wrong and apparently some Christians formed a resistance against newfound weapons of mass destruction taking over the world and then new crusades happened and... something something fastforward nearly 20 years of games to the actual story of Revelator. At least I found it quite entertaining and consistent.

For all the hype of quality of life, the game has pretty notable learning curve. It is nothing too uncommon in fighting games nor I would consider it a bad thing at all, but Guilty Gear is rather technical to the point you will eventually have to consult a fighter jet manual to understand what is going on, and simply practice proper (and sometimes outright rigid) procedures how to deal with various situations. Some of them are easy to search or try out in training, mode others are really convoluted and bizarre until you simply memorise what the deal was in the first place. Depending on the character in question, character matchup and other variables it can range from simple answers to the need to memorise several very specific circumstances and having only one real option to deal with it, where even tiniest mistake can mean instant loss. The game is also heavy on setplay, which is about forcing knockdowns into circumstances where they retain the advantage and ensure the opponent has as few options as possible to keep it their turn. The overwhelming amount of "you are not allowed to do anything" hits very hard and improving in the game is a pretty long road to deal with, especially for those with no former genre experience or more casual background. Another notable aspect is the game's playerbase. Random lobbies do exist but due to variable connections, where on Earth you live and GG being bit of a niche in already not-necessarily-that-popular-genre, your best bet may to find people to play with either by Steam or Discord or [insert something here]. Preferably with a touch of masochism while at it.

It is a very solid package of fluid gameplay and a good example how a fighting game's quality of life should be handled to ensure in spite of requiring a fighter jet pilot training to understand it on deeper level, all the necessary information how to get started is actually in the game as opposed to hidden on a 1990's 28k dialup optimised webpage on the Internet archive.

38031270.review:
１クール分のアニメに格闘ゲームが付いてきます。

格闘ゲームの枠に囚われない、戦闘一切無しの観るだけのストーリーモード。
ストーリーの内容について詳しくは書きませんが、前作Xrd-sign-含めて結構熱く楽しめました。
これだけでもセール時なんかには割と万人におすすめ出来ます。


・格闘ゲーム部分
正直格闘ゲーム初心者には厳しいです。
ゲーム内にチュートリアルや、実際操作する形の様々な講座がありますが
それでも最初の内は負けを重ねると思います。
ただしギルティギアは所謂人間性能よりも、知識や経験、練習による操作精度の安定などが重要で
やればやるほど強くなるというのが実感しやすいゲームではないかと思います。
キャラバランスについても今年の国際大会でtop8の使用キャラが全員違っていたので、
現状かなり良いのではないかと思います。

個人的には軽快に動くキャラに感動を覚えました。
ここまで軽快に動かせるゲームは他にないのではないかなぁと思います。
単純に動かしていて楽しいのでトレーニングモードも捗ります。


・ネット対戦(人口)の部分
人口は圧倒的にPS4版の方が多いようです。
しかしsteam版も全然人がいないという訳ではなく、
夜ならプレイヤーマッチの部屋がちょこちょこ立っています。
ただランクマッチはかなり人口少ないですし、PS4では盛況のロビーはsteam版では基本０人ですので
ガッツリやりたいという方はPS4版をオススメします。


・ネット対戦(ラグ等)の部分
お互いの回線状況次第といったところです。
ここ最近の日本の夜の回線は全体的に悪いようで、
ゴールデンタイムだと重いけど深夜だと快適になるという相手もちょこちょこおります。
回線状況が良い人同士でしたら、かなり快適に対戦出来ます。
また最近の他格闘ゲームで問題になっているロードもかなり早く、再戦もサクサクです。


私自身ギルティ始めて２～３ヶ月程度でまだまだ負けまくりですが、
それでも少しづつ強くなっていっているのを実感出来ているので面白いですよ。
歴戦のプレイヤーも多いのであまり気負わず、「その内絶対倒してやるからな、その内…。」
程度で楽しめる方でしたら初心者でもおすすめです。

길티기어 Xrd 시리즈는 XX 시리즈와는 다르게 언리얼 엔진으로 3D같은 2D게임의 느낌을 구현하였다.
XX 시리즈는 블블, 스파, 철권, 킹오파 시리즈를 접해온 필자로서도 조금 꺼려지는 그래픽이였다. 
하지만 Xrd, 특히 Rev를 보아라! 이 얼마나 멋진 그래픽인가! 길티기어의 그래픽 혁신을 가져온 Sign을 뒤이어 여러 세부적인 그래픽 요소까지 집어넣은, 그야말로 철권7 뺨치는 걸작이다! 다만..아쉬운 점이 있다면 국내층에 팬이 적다는 것이다.
요즘 국내 게임들에서 여러 콜라보를 실시하고 있지만, 그럼에도 인지도는 낮은 편이다.
마케팅을 콜라보로만 실시하지 말고, 좀 더 여러 분야에서 시도해보았으면 한다.
만약 해볼 의향이 있다면, 서슴치 말고 질러라! 적어도 필자는 후회는 안하리라 생각한다.
물론 격겜 특성상 맞으면서 배우는 게 조금 힘들기도 하고, 하도 온라인에 고인물이 많이 서식하다 보니 더 힘들어지기도 한ㄷ..

37872910.review:
If you are a fighting game fan that has only stuck to what you've grown up with, then I highly recommend you come out of your shell and give this a try. The game has a great tutorial for beginners and a high level of depth due to how different all the characters and the options that they all have. 

Gameplay wise, the game was made a bit easier so that it's more acessible to new comers. For example, the Roman Cancel system doesn't require strict timing for FRC anymore. Now you have YRC which is your new FRC and it's way easier to perform. However, just because the game was made easier doesn't mean it's any harder to master. You still need a solid understanding of fighting games to be good. Guilty gear has had an emphasis on the more aggessive side of things with mechanics such as negative penalty which removes all your meter for not fighting or back dashing too much. Also, you're rewarded with meter by attacking and moving forward. That doesn't mean that defense is completely butchered (SFV, I'm looking at you!). You have an alpha counter that you can use for half meter, DP, Burst, back dash, Faultless Defense, Blitz Shield and back dash.

On the more technical side of things, I would like to say that the PC version has the lowest input lag of all the platforms because you can turn a bunch of the fancy graphics settings. As for netcode, it can be a bit iffy if you don't have a good connection with your opponent because it's delay based (GREED SEVER) but most of the time it's playable.

Unfortunately, we're missing a few of the classic characters such as Bridget, Testament, Zappa and Anji. However, I do think that this game is totally worth it.

37838762.review:
I play a number of fighting games, and I half to say this game is VERY well done. Controls are simple: punch, kick, slash, heavy slash, and a "D" button for a heavy punch/kick. The characters are unique, and very interesting to play, providing a wide variety of playstyles even without having to buy dlc. 

I will say, this game is VERY anime-centric, so if you can't stand high-pitched girl voices, overly dramatic spiky-haired dudes with belts, and quite a bit of fanservice, then this might not be the best game for you. But even if you don't like that stuff, the gameplay is SO addictive, I'd still say give it a try.

The only problem is that there aren't really any people playing online most of the time, save for a couple small lobbies and the occasional ranked match later in the evening. However, if you get a friend to play this with you, you'll have the time of your life, I guarantee it. This studio is so talented, and I really hope they gain more traction in the US with the release of Dragonball FighterZ in January.

37835594.review:
Have been a fan of the series for years, and was quite impressed with the lastest installment. 

- The graphics here are a wonderful change of pace, The 3D models are rendered in such awasy that they look almost exactly like a high quality 2d animation cell, until the camera shifts and shows you a dynaic view.  

- The music, as allways, fits the world and rocks harder than than any other fighting serise. Ishiwatari rides again!

- The controls are as solid as ever, and still wonderfully responsive.  The series' fast and fluid combat has ruined me on Street Fighter, which seems horribly slow by comparison.

- While the game accomodates new or casual players with a "stylish" option (button masher's delight), the core game is still deeply nuaced for the hard core fans with roman canels and other high end play modifiers.

-The charcter roster is as divers as allways, with almost every character feeling unique. 

-The world and back ground story is fleshed out via your regular "story mode" of cuts scenes beetween battles, but also an additional multi- epiosode animated tale telling the back story and helping to further build on the world crisis.  

- A robust networkj mode with solid coding allows you to go online and play to your hearts content. (if thats you thing)  I tried it out a bit but prefer to play against people i can actually see in the same room)

-   While I'm not a fan in general of the dripfeed content method most fighting games seem to have embaced (holding back finished characters and adding them slowly as paid DLC) I must admit that Arcsystem seems to be trying to do tright by its fan base in releasing not a whole nrew physical erdition at full price, but a "REV2 update" which adds not only 2 new characters but new chapters of the animated story and more. 

Overall I highly recommend Guilty Gear Xrd to any fighting game fan.

37809656.review:
the latest iteration of a long running series, and the 2nd part of the xrd trilogy, guilty gear xrd -revelator- is truly a magnificent beast.

since the launch of the xrd series in xrd -sign-, arc system works have moved from the traditional sprite based art, to a fully 3rd rendered, cell-shaded art direction instead, and it has worked wonderfully. graphically, guilty gear looks amazing, and as it stands, one of the prettiest looking fighters out in the market, more so if you're an anime fan. it's this art style that would bring to life the (also) amazing lookng dragon ball fighter z, but that's another story (or review rather) for another game.

in terms of gameplay, the basic combos system and mechanics of guilty gear have been brought over (primarily from the xx series it seems), and it translates very well too, with constant tweaks made since xrd -sign-  so it essentially feels very much like any guilty gear game and not a complete overhaul in that sense.

there's also a good variety of characters for you to pick and choose from; some are old favorites from the previous guilty gear series, reworked; and some are completely new ones, but it's fairly well balanced regardless. of course, some fan favorites are missing from the older series, but personally, i think it's not a bad thing. let the sleeping dogs lie, and let the new guys come out and play.

as for the story, revelator makes a point of taking you through one hell of a ride, and with the graphics engine now, it feels like you're watching a very well animated 2d anime. even the arcade mode tells you a bit of the characters' back stories, so everything ties up nicely.

all in all, guilty gear xrd -revelator- is a superb game, and nearly perfect in many aspects. while i have always been more of a king of fighters player, and while street fighter have always been the biggest title in terms of 2d fighters, i have to concede that this current iteration of the guilty gear series, may well be just one of the best fighters out there now!

highly recommended!

37449953.review:
I have been looking for a fighting game to sit on the shelf as being the favourites for being easy to play for beginners to get into and a joy to learn and master like the original Soul Calibur on the Dreamcast.

Guilty Gear Xrd -Revelator- proudly sits there with it.The depth in the tutorials and samples of how to perform the moves reminded me of SC1, and then they added more with Rev by pretty much making the tutorial instead of being one where Sin gets bullied a lot it's a fun and silly platformer.

The game then has as well a serious tutorial and training setup to learn to pull off specials and combos for every character. The episode mode is basic arcade fare, whil;e the game also has a long-winded anime story which I'm guilty of falling asleep to.

My only real gripe with the game is the video settings on first boot being a bit awkward to fix but not that bad in the grand scheme of things. The art style may not be my proverbial cup of tea however the sheer attention to detail and characterisation of the characters in their attacks and their recoveries indicate that this was a labour of love.

If I get 10% of the longevity out of this I did out of Soul Calibur well, it's done a hell of a job.

37321717.review:
9.5 / 10 
몇 자 적어볼까 합니다.

종합하여 한 마디로 표현하면, 

대전 게임 중에서는 2017년 기준 무조건 이걸 추천하는 바  입니다. 철권? 킹오파? 스파? 그래요 사람많아요. 시스템도 좋죠. 

그런데 이 게임에 손을 들어준데는 몇가지 이유가 있습니다. 

그 이유를 풀어볼까 합니다.







1. 전작과 비교한 발전이 보이는 그래픽과 연출

그래픽과 그걸 충분히 이용하는 연출장면이 여태 대전게임중 역대급이라고 생각합니다.

3D 카툰을 이용한 것같은데, 이게 대충보면 2D로 보일 정도로 정교합니다. 이를 이용한 기술 연출이 그 절정이죠.

이게 어느 정도냐면 스토리 모드에 인트로 동영상 전부가 이 그래픽으로 되어있어요. 한 편의 애니메이션을 본 느낌입니다. 

저는 1화 정도 밖에 못했습니다만, 아래의 평가를 보니 전부 애니메이션으로 되어있다네요.

 일본 애니메에 항마력이 부족하신분들은 이 부분이 조금 걸릴수 있습니다.







2. 초보를 위하는 튜토리얼

이 부분도 추가점을 주겠습니다. 처음 게임을 기동 할 때, 여타 다른 게임들을 시작하면 튜토리얼을 직접 찾아가야 했죠. 

그런데 이 게임은 처음인거같다고 튜토리얼로 바로 가시겠습니까? 라고 묻더군요. 길티기어는 오락실에서도 몇 판 해봤으니, 더 있겠냐 싶었지만 그래도 한 번 둘러보기로 했죠.

그런데 이게 결코 심심하진 않더란겁니다.여태 튜토리얼은 캐릭터 두명 (항상 주인공과 그 라이벌이죠)에, 움직이는 방법에, 키를 가르쳐 주고... 뭐 그래요 뻔하죠.길티기어는 여기서 한발 더 나갔습니다. 

이동을 예로 들어볼게요. 기존의 대전 게임은 이런 느낌이에요. '자, 넌 이 게임이 처음이고, 키보드도 처음이겠지, →를 눌러봐. 그럼 앞으로 갈거야.'   →  '아이구 짝짝짝 잘하시네요. 다음으로 넘어가죠.'

길티기어도 여기까진 비슷해요. 그런데 이걸 잘 숙지했는지 장애물 같은걸 던져넣고 목표 지점까지 가서 몬스터를 한대 쳐보란겁니다. 

덕분에  전혀 심심하지 않았네요. '이 정도만 알면 정말 기본을 한거같다. 이제 내가 원하는 캐릭터를 골라야겠어. '

이 생각이 바로 들더군요. 이 게임을 처음 접하시는분들은 무조건 튜토리얼을 하시기 바랍니다. 전혀 지루하지 않았습니다.







3. 연습 시스템 캐릭터를 정했으니, 기술을 익히러 가야겠죠. 여기서도 초보자의 배려가 돋보입니다.기존 대전게임은 이렇게 나옵니다. 
 ↓↘→ + P 아주 대표적인 커멘드기 때문에, 별 어려움 없어보입니다. 그런데 그건 어디까지나 게임을 해온 사람들 입장이에요. 
아무것도 모르는 어린 애가 문방구 앞 작은 오락기 앞에 있다고 생각해 보세요. 저 정도는 쉬울수 있지만, →←↙↓↘→ + P이런건 어때요.
그런데 길티기어는 아예 레버와 버튼을 보여주고, 레버가 어떻게 움직이는지 보여줍니다. 생각 많이 했다는게 느껴지더군요.







3. 보이스와 사운드

이게 또 박진감 넘칩니다. 길티기어는 배경음악이라거나 타격음은 예전부터 일품이었죠.

여기에 캐릭터의 기합이나 비명소리도 멋집니다만, 이 부분은 좀 시끄러울수 있어요. 특히 여자 캐릭터는 이게 좀 심하더군요.







제가 즐긴 부분은 여기 까지입니다. 여기까지만해도 이 게임이 그냥 만들어진 느낌이 아니란게 느껴져요. 물론, 대전게임이니 만큼엄청나게 어렵겠죠. 

혹은 '그래봐야 사람없는 고인물이면 뭐하러 이 게임하냐'라고 하신다면 전 이렇게 얘기하고싶군요.

'게임은 사람많은것으로 평가가 되어선 안된다.' 라고요.

점수는 대전게임만 볼 때, 9.5/10 입니다.  0.5는 어려워서 빼기로 했습니다.

37166059.review:
If you're worried about if a fighting game like this is right for you, or if you'll get any enjoyment out of it despite being a total newbie like I am, don't be. This game's tutorial is probably as complete as it gets, and there are tons of online resources online also. And the community is pretty chill, even if it's smaller compared to the bigger titles like Tekken 7 and SFV.

With that all said, this is one of the best fighting games out on the market. Game runs amazing, gameplay is fluid and rewards patience, all the characters are pretty badass, the story is also worth (it's basically a 3d anime), just get it and you won't regret it.

BTW, if you are lost on what version to buy and want the latest version, get the one that says "GUILTY GEAR Xrd -REVELATOR- (+DLC Characters) + REV 2 All-in-One (does not include optional DLCs)" This won't have the additional optional DLC, but it does come with all the fixins you care about (includes Dizzy).

37108090.review:
TL;DR
Best fighting game imo, badass characters, cute waifus, great soundtracks, go click that "Add to cart" button already

OPINION
I gotta be honest, this game is what makes me love fighting games, got me hooked for 10 hours straight for testing all characters, watching the story, fishing (yeah, you can get figurines, music, and collectibles), etc. I prefer keyboard over usual controllers because there are 6 buttons (actually 5, 1 is a macro)

STORY
The story is pretty confusing if you are new to the series, which is why GG put a terminology button if the players are confused with the words.

GAMEPLAY
Guilty Gear is a fast-paced fighting game with lots of characters with different playstyle.
For example: 
Sol Badguy: an all-rounder which makes it perfect for newcomers
Sin Kiske: a character who deals huge damage and easy to execute combos, but requires appetite gauge. If a player tries to make Sin do a special move with zero appetite gauge, he will be "stunned" and will be more vulnerable to attacks
Jack-O: Summons her minions, and can explode them on command, dealing huge damage
Potemkin: a slow character who can't run, but has huge defense and great throwing power, keep your distance if you are fighting him.
Chipp: he can teleport to either enemy's front, back, or above, a very fast character with unpredictable moves, but has the lowest defense of the game

After all that, there are some mechanics that makes GG unique to other fighting games:
Tension gauge: filled by moving to your opponent, dealing and receiving damage, tension gauge can be used for Roman Cancels, Overdrives, and much more.
Roman Cancel: slows down time for a while and cancels your action, making it perfect to execute more combos or escape from enemy projectiles. Uses 25% tension gauge

I can go on for a more lengthy review but I'm too lazy to type all of it. There's so many to love from this game, I really recommend this game to everyone who loves fighting games.

37107041.review:
내 인생 최고의 격투게임인 길티기어 시리즈의 최신작.

XRD 때부터 호평받은 그래픽은 더 발전했고 에피소드(아케이드), 애니 같으면서 적당히 재미있는 스토리 모드, 혼자 컴 깨면서 능력자 되는 MOM, 애캐들 가지고 포즈 만들며 덕질 좀 할 수 있는(?) 피규어 모드까지 혼자 놀거리가 너무 다양하다.

기본 대전 시스템은 초보도 쉽게 할 수 있는 스타일리쉬 모드도 갖추고 있으며, 미션, 트레이닝, 콤보  등 게임 난이도를 고려하여 너무나 초보 친화적으로 짜여져 있다. 능력이 심하게 후달리지 않는다는 전제하에서 연습시간 조금만 투자해도 비슷한 초보를 금방 이길 수 있는데다가, 이런거 싫으면 스타일리쉬 모드 고르고 막 누르기만해도 무시무시한 실력을 낼 수 있다.(중수 근접한 유저들도 방심하면 스타일리쉬 사용자한테 쳐맞는 수듄;;)

대전이 가능한 모드는 랭킹, 로비, 플레이어 매치가 이는데,랭킹은 산소 호흡기 꽃은 수준이라 사람 만나기가 힘들고 로비는 그냥 전멸이다. 플레이어 매치만 살아있는데, 제한 코드도 정할 수 있어 초보들은 중망호라는 그룹에서 코드를 확인하고 접속할 수 있다. 게다가 스팀 유저들과 친추가 늘어날 수록 스팀의 장점인 아이디 게임 참가로 쉽게 매치 방에 접근할 수 있다.

안에서 트레이닝 하면서 사람오는거 기다릴 수도 있고지쳐서 멍 때리는 사람들과 수다도 떨면서 아바타 이미티콘 써가면서(움직임) 놀면 된다.

개인적으론 Xrd 시절엔 소심함 때문에 중, 고수들에게 맞고 관뒀지만, 신작을 빠르게 스팀에 내고 유저들 많아지고 중, 고수들이 뉴비 친화적이게 되면서 힘들지만 노력해보니 제대로 정착할 수 있었다.(진짜 뉴비들은 길티갤이나 중망호 가라) 나만해도 이젠 생초보들 가르쳐주면서 실력 키우고 있고..뛰어난 그래픽과 파고들만한 게임성(그로인한 실력차가 절망적이지만) 덕에 손을 놓지 못하고 있다.

유저들이 하는 말이 있다. 추라이 추라이~ 도전하라 길티기어 Xrd Rev2에. 혼자 가볍게 놀기에도 딱 좋은 게임이다.

36787386.review:
Netcode surpreendentemente bom, considerando que é baseado em input delay.

Visual cel-shaded inigualável, apenas em certos closeups fica evidente que são modelos 3D.

Trilha sonora excelente, especialmente para quem curte heavy metal e derivados.

Modo Story peca por não ter momentos jogáveis, mas ainda é interessante de acompanhar, nem que seja pelo visual anime.

Jogabilidade com uma ampla gama de opções ofensivas e defensivas, o que garante horas de diversão só no aprendizado das várias mecânicas de jogo. Sim, Danger Time é aleatório e o jogo viveria bem sem ele, mas não creio seja suficiente para evitar uma recomendação.

O jogo também conta com tutoriais demonstrando mecânicas e forçando o jogador a aprendê-las através da repetição (algo que outros jogos de luta poderiam copiar).

Recomendado, especialmente se essa for sua primeira incursão no mundo dos fighting games "anime". Pegue o pack do Rev2, que traz mais personagens e ajustes de equilíbrio a par das outras plataformas (até o momento da escrita desse review, ao menos).

 would yrc 236HS again

36340024.review:
Currently a good candidate for best fighting game ever made, even in this competitive time of good 2D fighters.

The character variety is beyond what I've seen elsewhere.  Take the movement mechanics, for one example: I-no's regular dash lifts her off the ground, allowing her to access her air moves easily while approaching; Slayer teleports short distances instead of dashing; fitting his manly character, Johnny's forward dash is longer than his backwards hop; even Sin's pretty average backdash is animated as a backflip using his staff.  People run, jump, fly and teleport ninja-style all over the place.  Stylin.  There's a lot of personality here, and there's bound to be a character you like among the mix of heavy metal and anime inspired designs.  Sol has a giant belt buckle with the word FREE scratched into it, and his bandana says ROCK YOU.  The visuals and music are top tier.

The online features are very well done.  The lobbies are like little arcades; you walk around as your avatar, type in chat, and spectate or jump on one of the little arcade machines and join somebody for a battle.  It's awesome, you can easily jump off a machine and watch somebody else's fight to relax until you're ready to go again.  Best lobby system for a fighting game that I've ever seen.  Being able to switch to spectating right away helps to dim the pain of getting rekt (many beginners aren't brave enough to try an online lobby - those people tend to stay beginners.  Be brave, and don't let damaged pride stop you from fighting to improve!).  It really hearkens back to ye olde arcade days.

I can't explain it in terms of frame data, but where combos in BlazBlue felt 'restrictive' to me, I find that the gattling combos here tend to be more freeform and custom once you figure out what-links-into-what.  That's not to say certain characters aren't extremely execution-heavy; try Chipp or Millia if you're a combo pro.  Of course, certain chains only work on characters of the right height/size, so you sometimes have to adapt your 'maximal' combos to suit the character you're fighting.  You don't just learn your own character: you learn how your character deals with the other 20-some characters.  You do that by playing, watching, and maybe doing research if you really want to crack a certain character who's beating you.  Ya gotta figure out what your own good moves are, too!

There's a lot of casual content to enjoy (an entertaining story mode, the usual arcade modes and color/gallery unlockables, etc.) and an incredibly rich tutorial system (tons of challenges to teach you the systems and get your muscle memory started).  There's even a 'stylish' control mode for people who need some time understand the flow of a fighting game, and who want to do some flashy moves without having to learn complex inputs right away.

But, if you really want to get good at this game, you have to be prepared to lose a lot in PvP.  That's just the nature of a fighting game: the journey from noob to pro is the content.  Instead of grinding an RPG character, you're grinding your brain, reflexes and muscle memory.  This is real.  You may face one or two people who have been doing that since the original Guilty Gear about 20 years ago.  You're going to want to join a Discord channel or other community hub so you can absorb other peoples' experience and complain together about Raven.  Only Raven players like Raven.

36249502.review:
After playing hundreds of matches on PC, PS4 and the odd arcade match, I can confidently say this is the most fun I've had in a fighting game in my life.

Wonderful characters, art and presentation. An attention to detail I've seldom seen, and it comes through in every aspect of the game. Between the intros, outros, overdrives, instakill cinematics, character lines/interactions and godly rock/metal OST, I don't see how anybody can make the case for this game not looking and sounding amazing.

The gameplay is absolutely fantastic. Between the myriad of universal mechanics and the wacky character specific stances/setups/quirks, you will be able to play this game for hundreds of hours and still find yourself saying "Wait, that WORKS?" on some matches.

The only downside I can think of is that this game has basically turned me into a Jehovah's witness. You will start trying to get everybody you know to play this game. Usually with little success, as the super steep learning curve and anime aesthetic will put most people off. BUY THIS GAME.

36073203.review:
Superior to Sign in every aspect and one of the very best fighting games of this generation.

The gamplay has been fine tuned to near perfection. Blitz Shield is much easier to use, Side Dusts are now a thing, less input delay, even better online, lots of balance changes to help close the gaps between tiers and numerous features that cater to both hardcore and casual fans. 

Blitz Charge is probably my favorite addition as it not only makes the Blitz mechanic easier to use (at the cost of less reward), but it allows for some intense mindgames. The overhauled Side Dusts are amazing too, giving players even more ways to punish their opponents in the corner and opening up a plethora of new combos and strats. 

If you are completely new to Guilty Gear, fear not, for Revelator has lots of in-depth tutorials (Most of them from Sign, but the main tutorial is brand new!) to help teach newcomers all about the game and even a Stylish control scheme. Combos too hard? Struggling to learn command inputs? Why, for only 20% less health pick up the Stylish type and you'll be good to go! The in-game encyclopedia from Sign has also been carried over and updated with entries related to all the new stuff in Revelator.

All the new extras are amazing too. Currently I have 600+ hours, but a good chunk of those were spent just messing around in Gallery, Story and Digital Figure. A lot of the online stuff is sadly carried over from Sign, but there's stil a lot of new content to be unlocked! The VA interviews were definitely my favorite thing to unlock. It was really nice listening to them share their thoughts on the game.

That said, you're gonna need the Rev 2 DLC, if you wanna play online, since everybody has moved on to that version. You can still ask for matches, as long as folks are willing to switch back to the previous version.

A must buy. Let's enjoy a great showtime!

十三年前街机厅里，新进了一台机子，叫ggxx，起初大家都不愿意去玩。kof97在街机厅的地位无可撼动。
一天一个大神在97机上把我手上的币全打没的时候（别问我为啥输了还跟他打，人家仨机选一串三，我气不过。）我看到了ggxx上有人投了硬币却不愿意去玩扔下机子离开。飞速走过去在最后一秒选了梅喧（主要是看到大欧派移不动摇杆了）。第一次玩嘛，就一直踩榻榻米（正半K）。被ai医生虐到空血的时候炸气一顿乱按，一记居合捅到了医生，动画结束的时候发现我身边站了好几个人都惊讶道这游戏真鸡儿有意思，这种空血翻盘在其他格斗游戏里无异于痴人说梦（双方水平相当的情况下）。之后大家多多少少开始玩ggxx，研究招式，交流技巧，渐渐接受了这个在多数街机厅玩家（大多为80后和90左右）认为画面太二刺螈的格斗游戏，老板也很给力不断添新，从一台机子，两台到整个一排。每天放学回家前去玩一局变成了生活中的常态（其实是97太菜没自信玩了）。
直到游戏厅涉嫌赌博被plc叔叔爆破，之后忙于学业再也没有机会玩。现如今已为社畜的我，看到ggxxx的时候，不觉间脸上挂上了那个当年13岁孩子在下学后跑向街机房的笑容。

35932046.review:
En gros :
Une merveille du jeu de combat actuel ! 
Un jeu élitiste (moi que les anciens guilty certes) qui fait le pari de de vous tirer vers le haut par un excellent set de tutoriel plutôt que d’appauvrir le gameplay pour être plus docile à la prise en main. Une réussite graphique et technique pouvant tous à fait vous occuper des heures et rentabiliser son prix largement. Bien que la communauté soit petite, le jeu reste joué et vous trouverez toujours des joueurs le soir et le week-end. N’hésitez pas à passer le logiciel discord (il y a un discord européen et un français actif pour guilty) pour prendre contact avec la communauté. Je ne peux que recommander chaudement que ce jeu à quiconque désirant un jeu de combat.

Graphisme :
Tournant sur l’unreal engine 3, le cell-shading est réalisé avec amour pour un résultat qui ressemble à s’y méprendre à un dessin animé japonnais « classique ». Unreal engine 3 oblige, le jeu tourne sur un toaster aujourd’hui, certains arrive à le faire tourner sans carte graphique en jouant sur la config. Je ne peux pas par contre supposer de vos goût pour le character design à vous de voir. Ça fait très « ado en phase rebelle » avec pas mal de 2nd degré, qui sauve le design pour moi.

Musique :
Du lourd, Daisuke Ishiwatari (le créateur du jeu) est un fan de heavy metal et de queen, ses compositions rock sont au poil pour le jeu. Je préfère cependant ses anciennes compos, qui sont déblocables dans le jeu !

Solo :
Le jeu a un mode arcade, d’excellent didacticiels et défis pour taffer les combos (ces combos sont pas toujours opti cependant), ainsi qu’un mode histoire (se présentant comme un mélange d’anime et de visual novel). 
Je ne m’attarderais pas sur le mode histoire, Daisuke Ishiwatari ne brille pas par son niveau d’écriture. Le scénar faisant suite à l’opus précédent est d’un exécution médiocre malgré de bons concepts. Pour moi le lore et l’histoire sont justes des bonus, c’est cool d’avoir du contexte pour l’univers du jeu
Il y a de nombreux bonus à débloquer dont le mode figurine pour se faire des diorama avec les persos du jeu pour les complétionistes.
Rien à redire sur la quantité du contenu solo.

Multi :
Vous trouverez des joueurs européens au heures pleines (moi sûr aux heures creuses). La commu est sympa et pour la très majorité enthousiaste d’avoir du sang neuf pour agrandir la famille.
L’essentiel des joueurs joue dans les players rooms, le reste des modes (ranked et gros lobby) n’est pas joué. Créer une room pour débutant si il y en a pas.
Le netcode est un système par délai. On peut avoir facilement 2-3f de délai avec des gens de France ou pays voisin. Ne jouer pas en wifi : les micro-lags, c’est dégeux.
L’astuce étant de réduire les options graphiques en multi , comme mettre en off les effets de lumières et la v-sync (pas besoin de toucher à la résolution) pour passer de 3,5f d’input delay de base (=version ps4) à 1f (on en rêve tous hein) et donc en additionnant l’input delay d’1f et un lag de 2-3f, on a un jeu online qui simule le offline. C’est un plaisir à jouer.

Gameplay :
Le gameplay est riche, profond et rapide, mais propose de se découvrir de manière progressive des mécaniques les plus simples ou plus avancé (le tuto en anglais guilty grear crash course sur youtube est chouette). Pour les habituez de jeu de combat, les combos se font en très en grande majorité par des gatlings, vous êtes beaucoup plus libre de vos mouvements dont dans les air : course pour quasi tous les persos, block aérien, dash aérien… Le jeu fait la part belle à l’oki et au taff préalable en mode training (je ne peux qu’insister sur second point, il faut taffer pour y arriver sur guilty).
La grosse 20ène de perso est très varié avec beaucoup d’originalité. Il y a juste de tous, du shoto, du gros choppeur, des persos qui zones avec des projectiles, un perso avec un stand à la jojo et en j’en passe. Les persos sont « très fort » (plus proche marvel que de street). Vous pouvez tout jouer (preuve: les tournois au japon ont beaucoup de diversité dans les persos qui arrive aux phases finales). Il y a cependant 2 persos qui traîne tout de même dans la tier list.

35930775.review: Jeu de combat le plus dynamique proposé à l'heure actuelle. De beaux graphismes (RIP les sprites 2D si fidèles à la série des GG) accompagnés d'une bande son hallucinante mêlant nouveaux thèmes et ceux des anciens opus de la série. 34302380.review:
WHAT YOU NEED TO KNOW:
(Which Guilty Gear Xrd is the right one?) The most current one is Rev2, which also has the most users currently. It is an expansion of Revelator. You can get the full package by getting Rev and Rev2 for $45, or get the game with every DLC pack for $60 (you MUST buy Revelator to get Rev2. Sign is a seperate game entirely). Steam sales do not apply.

Positives:
+AMAZING 3d characters modeled to look like 2d characters.
+Fantastic Anime artstyle and hard rock soundtrack.
+25 characters, each with their own completely unique design and gameplay. I GUARANTEE your favorite character will be in this game!
+BEST TUTORIAL IN ANY FIGHTING GAME! Jack-O teaches you the basics by letting you fight her minions! LEARN AND HAVE FUN PLAYING MINIGAMES WHILE DOING IT!
+Little FAQ bubbles every time you pause will help you master the basics, among other things!
+M.O.M. mode makes for a great single player experience collecting power-ups and stat boosters to fight the cpu!
+Very smooth online experience with frame delay shown at all times!
+FANTASTIC lobby system! Create your own little avatar and walk around in rooms with up to 8 or sometimes 64 players!
+One of the most complex 2d fighting games out there with SO MUCH to learn!

Negatives:
-Confusing presentation at first. Navigating the menus and various other things will take a few tries.
-Confusing story mode (encyclopedia and other useful things help, but only for so far).
-Tutorial teaches you the bare basics of how fighting games are played, but not much detail into bursts, faultless defence, blitz shield, and all of the things that make Guilty Gear stand out from other fighting games.
-Players have fled Ranked and currently stick around in custom lobbies.
-Worth $45? $60? Probably for online mode or playing with friends, but not much else.
-Lack of GGPO (although not a big deal for most, since online is pretty smooth)
-One of the most complex 2d fighting games out there with SO MUCH to learn...

WHAT DO YOU THINK?
There's so much love put into every little detail like the presentation, the bursts, the defence, the combos however long or short, the character designs, and even little things like making a little square-headed avatar for lobbies and fishing for random cosmetics that it's really hard not to love this game if you're really into fighters. If you're not, it's going to be hard getting into Guilty Gear (especially at it's price range), but the tutorial in this game will get you on the right foot. If you like this game and need some help, now is the time to join. New players are already joining Rev2 in anticipation for Dragonball Fighters Z, ArcSys's newest title. I recommend getting this game on sale at some point, but otherwise is such a good fighter. Get some friends and join us on Discord! You won't regret it!

A lot of effort has been put in to make this game as fun as possible for as many as possible.  Great tutorials (basics, special moves and combos for every character, and advanced mechanics/matchups for the deeper parts), lots of characters all well balanced and each with their own little episode, different game modes and difficulties, and lots of stuff to collect.

The long (non-interactive) story mode is entertaining once it gets going too (watching the SIGN story first helps), I'd now buy any follow-up game just because of it (it is sub-titled rather than dubbed for English, but I found the pacing was always comfortable for keeping up).

I don't know if it is a translation thing but I think the character naming session was amusingly brief:

Q:  What do we call our edgy main character to show he is an anti-hero and a badass?
A: Badguy

Q: What do we call our villain who sleeps and even fights in a bed constantly?
A: Bed Man

Q: What do we call the other man always shrouded in mystery?
A:  That Man

Nailed it.

33976930.review:
Probably the best fighting game ever made and one that I don't see myself getting bored of anytime soon. Let me break it down for you:

Pros:
-Best fighting game tutorial of all time
-Diverse cast of characters that have completely different styles of play from each other
-Relatively balanced game, you can do well with any character (low tier character got top 8 at EVO 2017 and mid tier got second place)
-Beautiful graphics and art style
-Fantastic soundtrack
-Deep gameplay with a near endless learning curve that will keep you coming back
-Tightly knit community of dedicated players
-Quickly growing competitive scene
-Easy to find games using player lobbies
-Control scheme is great for pad players
-Good amount of single player content
-A well written story with a ton of detail

Cons:
-Ranked is dead
-Fighting good players will make you enjoy the taste of semen

Overall, if you're looking for a fighting game that isn't mind numbing garbage *cough*streetfighterV*cough* then look no further than Guilty Gear.

I actually played a bit of GGXrd awhile back in REV Major 2017 (july 8-9). Got bodied hard, but still very happy. While obviously Tekken 7 has the main spotlight there, it didn't leave out the rest of the relevant fighting games. No regrets.

Buy the REV 2 Update at all costs. It includes 2 free characters and refurbishes the whole game.

The game pushes the 2.5 aspect of it by using really good camera angles whenever you land Dust hits or if you finish and enemy off with a special move/super combo. It also has one of the most forgiving tutorials ever, and like other previous reviewers have said, it doesn't shove the whole load in your mouth and leaves you to fend for yourself. There are numerous guides for all characters in every different combat situations, and every single character you play is unique, from movesets, to personality. I liked Leo best because of his stance mechanics and good gap closing. Baiken is also pretty great too, because of her Jubei palette, fast af moveset, and giant milk duds. I haven't really finished the story yet since MOM mode took most of my time, and playing with friends also did it, but yeah, overall a great fighting game, enough to rival the likes of Tekken 7, SFV, KOFXIV, and Smash. 

Faust's Kancho Kombo is the best one there is.

33810670.review:
まず、「Rev2」アップデートを購入したうえでのコメントになりますのであしからず。

GGXX#Reloadから久々に手を出しました。
近くにゲーセンがないなか、気軽にネット対戦できるのはありがたいです。
グラフィックに関しては言わずもがな、3Dであるにもかかわらずキャラクターを
アニメチックな2Dに表現しているので、従来の2D格闘ゲームをやってきた人でも
違和感なくやれるものとなっています。


◎オンライン対戦について
基本的にランクマッチでありロビーはあまり機能していませんので、
チャット等の交流も併せてやりたい場合は、SNSやニコ生、youtube等を活用した方が良いです。

ランクマッチは、格闘ゲームの経験があれば10段くらいまで登れるかと思いますし、
マッチングとしてもだいたいこの帯域から多くなりはじめます。
筆者としても、この階級から対等な人と巡り合う機会が多くなって、
やりこみが進み、気づいたら2ヶ月で１千戦弱やってました。


なお、マッチング頻度は30分で多くて３～４人（対戦時間込み）くらいなので、
トレーニングやアーケードモードをしながらまったり待つのが良いです。
逆に言えば、低階級は総じて人が少ないので、マッチング条件を強い人とやる等設定を変える必要が
出てきますが、一方的にやられることがあります・・・。

購入をお考えの方はこの点を理解したうえで検討をしたほうが良いです。
オススメしたいけども、敷居が高いがためにオススメ仕切れないところがあります。
それ故に、このゲームは経験者向けなら是非とも言える一品。
格闘ゲームの浅い方は、トレーニングやミッション、そしてオンライン対戦をひたすらこなさないと
このゲームの良さを実感できないゲームです。


・PCスペックについて
なるべくグラフィックボードはいいものを積んだほうが良いです。
オンライン対戦で動作がおぼつかない場合は、グラフィック設定を変えたり、
ステージを「JAPAN」や「Cental Organ Tower」など比較的軽いステージを指定しておくと良いです。


◎ストーリーについて
・正直なぜこれ単体でアニメ放映やDVD販売しないのか謎なほどに高い質・脚本ともにクオリティー。
これまでの作品でベールに包まれていた（ネタバレにつき省略）
ストーリー独自で難解な単語が多数ありますが、親切に解説も用意されています。
なお、前作SIGNからの続編につき、そちらを鑑賞したうえでの視聴をオススメします。

33786092.review:
[h1] 写在开头　[/h1]
　你最想玩的游戏是什么？一问到这个，大家肯定七嘴八舌说什么的都有。毕竟作为一个游戏爱好者，没几款自己中意的“对象”怎么行呢？但如果问题变成“你最想和异性朋友/死党一起玩的游戏”，估计很多人立刻就傻了眼。

　每个人对游戏的理解都不一样，这就导致了可能你喜欢的游戏别人却毫无兴趣。打怪升级带妹稍有不慎就是“大男子主义”。恐怖游戏则是悬崖走钢丝，“英雄”跟“狗熊”往往仅在一念之间。和死党玩游戏更是如此，一点挑战性都没有的游戏玩的是昏昏欲睡，竞技性强的打出火气来，又伤了感情。

　这个也不行那个也不行，总不能什么都不玩就大眼瞪小眼吧？也许大家心里或多或少都会有点想象的空间，但这绝对和格斗游戏无关。毕竟在这个对格斗游戏已经不再友好的时代，格斗游戏往往成了高对抗、难操作、老手痛揍新手少数玩家专属的代名词，但今天诺瓦玲要推荐的还就是这么一款和市面上那些格斗游戏老前辈们风格大不相同的作品，它叫《罪恶装备》，一款由Arc System Works开发的经典格斗游戏。

　在圈内一提到《罪恶装备》，大家立马想到Arc社这家开发了《苍翼默示录》等以华丽动画风格著称的格斗游戏厂商。然后便是堪称Arc社顶梁柱的石渡太辅，这位天才制作人不但是《罪恶装备》系列的总制作人，还同时担任了该系列的角色设定、插画、作曲、配音。正是凭借这位“劳碌命”制作人的努力，我们才得以见到这款拥有长篇剧情和复杂系统的格斗游戏。

[h1] 图文评测请点这里[/h1]
http://play.163.com/17/0802/10/CQR09KS400318QDE.html
 
　虽说《罪恶装备》系列早在1998年就发售了第一部作品，但却是在近几年来才涉足旗下作品3D化。在虚幻3引擎的加持下，游戏的画面人物得以重置，让该系列得以再获新生，而今天介绍的这款《罪恶装备：未知次元 - 启示者》（以下简称“罪恶装备”）便是该系列的最新作品。
[b]
　+3D渲染下极具张力的画面
　+对新人友好的操作系统
　+丰富有趣的可用角色
　+剧情模式内容充实
　+细节优化极其到位
　-角色目前尚不平衡
　-网络对战质量时好时坏[/b]

[h1] 华丽的游戏画面  个性鲜明的角色[/h1]
　从前作《罪恶装备：未知次元 -征兆》开始，《罪恶装备》便抛弃沿用了数十年的传统2D画风，转而投入3D动画渲染的怀抱中。虽说本质上游戏还是横版格斗，但如今作品的画面才真正体现出Acr社华丽动画风格的显著特点。

　人物的一招一式，彰显魄力。招式动作华丽，特效更是绚丽无比。配上3D绘制的大气背景，本作为我们展现了最高质量的手绘动画效果。相信在这样精美画面下的对战，绝对能为玩家带来不小的视觉冲击。

　在《罪恶装备》中，角色的形象还是以日系动漫风格为主，但在角色塑造上却又各不相同。标准的偶像派剑士、活泼天真的外卖少女、英伦绅士风的吸血鬼伯爵甚至是身材比例完全失衡的大块头重甲士兵，这些看似不像一个画风的人物却很好的融入在整个游戏的大舞台上。同时本作在前作的基础上，可用人数增加到了25人。
　　　　　　　　　　
[h1] 对新手友好的“轻快”操作  血脉喷张的战斗体验[/h1]
　和传统的主打拳脚互动的格斗游戏不同，《罪恶装备》里的人物携带诸如剑、枪、太刀等各式各样的武器。这就使得人物的招式更加多样化，进一步要求玩家对整个游戏要有充分的理解。同时人物的体型也并不是装饰之用，不同体型的角色受到伤害的反馈和僵直也会大不相同。

　看到这里一些玩家肯定就慌了，毕竟这么多新颖的设定，那对技术的要求肯定不低。这样的游戏怎么可能和朋友愉快的玩耍呢？这里就不得不提到Acr家的标志性系统“轻快型”模式。在轻快模式下，玩家仅需一个键位就可以打出华丽的连招和必杀，并且搭载自动防御机制，无疑是大幅度缩小了和老手之前的差距，以至于哪怕是第一次接触该游戏的玩家也有机会和老玩家们打得有来有回，体验更多的游戏乐趣。
　　　　　　　　　　　
　但作为平衡，使用轻快模式玩家的招式伤害略低于标准模式玩家的伤害，这就使得双方能站在一个相对公平的起点上。同时由于轻快模式出招的死板和僵硬，很多情况下并不能很好的根据战斗情况来改变策略，从而被老手们有机可乘。但至少“轻快型”出招可以拉近大家彼此的距离，让战斗变得更加趣味，更加激烈。而不是像大部分格斗游戏那样变成一边倒的乏味战斗。


[h1] “喧宾夺主”的剧情模式  单机模式内容充足[/h1]
　除了对新人友好的操作模式，《罪恶装备》另一个引人注目的地方无疑是剧情模式了，石渡太辅和好友森利道两位鬼才共同撰写了《罪恶装备》的庞大世界观。而本作的剧情模式直接就变成了一部长达8小时的动漫番，其中番剧的份量之足让很多粉丝戏称其是买动漫送格斗。

　同时在单机模式还有同样搭载了剧情动画的街机模式和帮助新手快速掌握游戏的道场模式。值得一提的是在本作中无论是线上还是单机只要完成战斗都会获得一定的奖励点数。而点数可以去画廊解锁一些诸如角色配色，人物原稿，CV访谈等可供收藏的小玩意。甚至还专门为此加入了专门的角色养成风格的M.O.M.模式，在这个模式里，选择一个角色，通过战斗解锁道具和能力，从而获得更多的点数奖励，也不失是一个消磨时间的好手段。

　这些看似不起眼的小东西支撑起了整个游戏的单机部分，大大增加了游戏的可玩性，让玩家们能闲暇之余体验到《罪恶装备》这部作品的魅力。当然如果是朋友造访家中，用本地双人对战一决胜负也是个不错的选择呢。

[h1] 丰富的线上 联机质量略显堪忧[/h1]
　线上模式虽然一如既往的分为匹配战和玩家建立房间的自由战，但这并不妨碍《罪恶装备》在一些方面做点文章。登录线上模式后，首先映入眼帘的是一个社区状的大厅，在这个最多可以容纳64个玩家的大厅里，玩家可以通过自己的拟人形象和周围的一切进行互动，比如钓鱼，踢球甚至直接坐在街机上和路人打上几局。本作的线上社区可以说相当成熟了。

　但联机方面依然是个老生常谈的问题，毕竟这要牵扯到网络延迟。虽然《罪恶装备》给出的方案有同地区联机，但有的时候如果该地区玩家过少，就会陷入无人可以匹配的窘境。而无限制匹配碰到其他国家的玩家往往延迟也是高的令人发指。同时因为人少的原因，新人碰到老手的机会大大增加了，弄不好就是一场被血虐的惨痛经历。不过也许和朋友单独开个房间进行战斗也会是个不错的选择？

[h1] 后记[/h1]
　《罪恶装备：未知次元 - 启示者》人气暂时不敌市场上那些高知名度的格斗游戏。但作为一款主打华丽动画的格斗游戏，《罪恶装备》无疑是成功的。同时其成熟的游戏机制和极低的门槛，让它成为和朋友之间互相切磋的理想游戏。或许《罪恶装备》不是最火的格斗游戏，但它绝对是最适合新人入坑体验格斗游戏魅力的首选。
