30782598.review:
Revelator..finally on PC.
So how do i feel about this game? Well...

Pros:
+Gameplay is smooth as butter and fast-paced as well. Always keeping the adrenaline rushing.
+The Artwork, It leaves me breathless. It's so beautiful and so well made!
+Amazing Soundtrack, It fits the gameplay perfectly and each character has it's own theme!
+The Tutorial, being really different from what it was in -SIGN- and it is MUCH better.
+The Combos/Missions Mode are more than enough for you to learn everything about the character/the mechanics.
+Fishing! A small yet entertaining way to unlock a lot of things.
+Digital Figures..Oh boy, you can spend hours and hours in this mode with the stuff you get exclusively from fishing.
+The variety of characters in the roster, Each having it's charm and unique playstyle!
+Daisuke Ishiwatari.
+The Waifus and Husbandos.
---
Cons:
-/+The price is a bit too expensive so it's hard to invite someone to get the game, but it's understandable with the amount of content the game has to offer.
-/+No English Dub, Yet. It was removed so the English Release would be closer to the Japanese one.
-/+The Story Mode is a looong cinematic (Of up to +7 hours!), that means. It's not playable like it was on the Arcade mode of -SIGN-. But, it's a continuation and it's beautiful.
-If you dislike Anime then..this game will literally melt you, that goes for those who also hate Japanese voices, but you can turn them off in the options menu.
-/+Like every fighting game ever. It's easy to pick up and hard to master. Like it should be.
-Buying the game now when Revelator 2 is coming out soon (in May)..That means..Even more expensive!
-Only being able to get stuff for your Lobby avatar via Fishing..
-You can't play with One Keyboard & One Controller. The game won't recognize the Controller as Player 2..So you are forced to use TWO controllers for Local play.
---
The game is pretty underrated in my opinion. And that may be due to it's price being high.
I don't blame anyone for that. Since the old GG's are pretty popular from what i've seen, and every single one of them is good, having amazing soundtrack and gameplay. Always.

So..Do i recommend this game?
Absolutely, For me. It's easily the best fighting game of 2017. The only bad thing being the price like i said before.
And if you buy it now. You can buy Revelator 2 later (Unless you are poor like me and you are not gonna do that.)
But if you don't want to. You don't have to and just enjoy the game as it is. Like it should be, without paying for extra-content.

My rating for this game is easily a Golden 10/10.
I really RECOMMEND this.

游戏很好玩，和大多数人的评价不一样的是，我觉得这个游戏其实是很适合格斗游戏新手的一款。

因为该游戏相对于其他格斗游戏，进攻的一方更加有利。有一半技能是加帧技，即便对手防御主动依然是进攻一方；即便不是加帧技，有明显破绽的招式也不多。总之比起那些需要反应的游戏，这个游戏只要一直玩水平提高很快。很多人觉得这个游戏比较难的原因主要还是因为高手很新手差距比较大，但同时也说明这个游戏想要提高水平是比较容易。

教程做的很好，画面也很精良。当然对于电脑配置有一定要求，我是960GTX算是勉强能开最高效果。比起苍翼默示录的苍之魔法书符文的五毛特效，这个游戏终结技启动的时候，不光是每个人物完全不同的终结技背景，而且还是完整的动画。

建议新手刚玩选择索尔和凯这两个新手角色，上手会更快一点。

9/10
罪惡裝備啟示錄：華麗的無可言表！
如果你不是一個熱愛格鬥遊戲的玩家，以下是你入手這款遊戲的理由：
1.精美的人設，造型，每個角色形態各異，個性鮮明，你能在其他動漫找到的性格屬性，遊戲裡也能找到。
2.劇情全程動畫，全程配音，全程各種BGM，虛幻引擎所打造的3d動畫和場景令人印象深刻，那些個BGM更是獲好評無數。劇情綿長，世界觀龐大，而且自帶簡體繁體中文，翻譯精準，當做一部動畫來看絕對讓你知乎過癮！
3.各種有趣的額外功能，美術館欣賞，收集任務手辦，姿勢，噴漆，這麼多功能總有你喜愛的。
4.就算你是一個手殘玩家，也不用擔心，本作和蒼翼默示錄一樣，擁有所謂的stylish模式，只要按簡單的幾個鍵，就能打出很多很華麗的連擊，裝逼玩家必備！
如果你是一個熱愛格鬥，喜歡鑽研各種combo的玩家，你能從這個遊戲裡發掘出更多的樂趣：
1.本作是ARC system works 旗下知名的格鬥系列，這個系列本身就有很長的歷史，再加上arc公司擁有多年開發格鬥遊戲的經驗，在這方面上有很高的造詣（其知名系列還有蒼翼默示錄等），使得更換新引擎的本系列迅速吸引各類格鬥粉的眼球，成為當下格鬥界裡熾手可熱的對戰遊戲。
2.本作加上dlc，共有超過20名角色可選擇（未來還會出啟示錄2，啟示錄一代玩家可以通過購買dlc升級為二代，新增新的角色和技能），每個作色的戰鬥風格迥異，都各自搭載了獨有的一套系統，這使得對戰變得更加多變有趣，同時也是得難度大增，簡而言之，這是一款很難精通的遊戲。
3.精緻的場景，令人心潮澎湃的對戰音樂，各種技能命中時的特色鏡頭和一擊必殺的華麗動畫，都令人十分享受


總而言之，可以很負責任的說，即使是原價買入，也絕對不會覺得虧，因為這真是難得的好遊戲，沒入手的朋友快快剁手吧！

30572059.review:
I would say this is currently the best fighting game on the market. The game shines and excels in pretty much every element. It might not be the easiest fighter, but it's definitely the one worth learning. Anyways, let me explain a bit more in detail what makes this game so damn good.

Characters: Every character in roster feels unique and interesting, be it when it comes to the gameplay itself, their design, or their backgrounds and personalities, which you will see both in story and in gameplay itself. They even have special interactions between each other during combat(while executing certain special moves or instant kills), and things like that really add to the overall experience.

Gameplay: Fighting is fun and fast paced, although it isn't the simplest fighter out there, since it has quite a lot of mechanics that you will probably need to learn if you wanna play well. Still, it doesn't feel overwhelming and it's definitely worth learning. When it comes to characters, no character feels the same and they often have some very character-specific mechanics(Sin's food meter, Johnny's coins etc.) which adds to their overall playstyle variety and gives a lot of interesting matchups. 

Graphics: Best looking fighting game out there, no contest. Great looking backgrounds, amazing looking characters and animations. -SIGN- already looked damn amazing, -REVELATOR- looks even better with some graphical updates like dynamic lighting that affects characters and backgrounds. 

Music: Guilty Gear always had an amazing soundtrack and this game is no expection. One of the best soundtracks ever made IMO. There are also tons of hard rock and heavy metal references through the whole game, not only in OST, but also in character designs, move names, story etc. etc. which you will probably appreciate if you like that kind of music. You can also unlock most of the BGMs from previous GG games with in-game money. 

Story: Revelator has a non-interactive 5 hour story mode, which is essentially a movie, fully voiced and animated. Story is quite fun and enjoyable, although there's a lot of anime bs in second half.

Tutorial: They made a brand new tutorial for this game, which tries to explain basic fighting game mechanics through mini games. Then there is and advanced section with missions that try to explain some more advanced mechanics through practical use in combat and also matchup specific stuff. For some reason, some of the mechanics, like danger time, aren't explained in either of those two modes, although they are mentioned and roughly explained in FAQ which you can open in pause screen. Not sure why would they bother making a brand new tutorial mode and then omit stuff like that, even though those were all included in -SIGN- tutorial mode.

Other content: Besides stuff mentioned above, there is M.O.M. mode, Arcade mode, Versus Mode Training mode, Online mode with ranked matchmaking and player lobbies, where, besides usual fighting and spectating, you can show off your avatars, emotes and also play football(kind of). There's also a fishing minigame and a Figure mode thing. Not sure what that last one is all about, I guess for making artwork or something. There's plenty of stuff that you can purchase with ingame money, like extra BGMs, colors, avatars, emoticons etc.

30485158.review:
As far as I can tell, this is probably the most friendly fighting game on the current market for newcomers to fighting games. Aside from having probably the best cell-shaded graphics on the market (where the characters pretty much look like they would in 2-D), and one of the best soundtracks, the game also goes a step further and has a story that...while not the best, is defintely fun enough to watch.

Unlike it's predecessor, -Sign-, -Revelator- Includes the "stylish" fighting style. This is very similar to Marvel Vs Capcom's "Easy" Controls from dreamcast. When you mash certain buttons, you will perform a combo of attacks, and you also are given a special button to do certain overdrive moves. It does have many downsides, as it will make your character weak than Technical, on top of limiting your combos to only what the game gives you. But if you are completely new to fighting games and just want to jump in to the single player and try to enjoy it before you learn, then this is a very good option to do so. I do not recommend it for multiplayer unless you are against someone else using stylish, however.

The story mode has a huge fault due to being non-interactive, however it also has the plus of being an unfragmented, fairly decent 3-4 hour story. And on top of this, you still have the typical Arcade mode and M.O.M. (which is basically a replayable single player mode). To add though, unlike -Sign-, -Revelator- does not have dubbed voices, meaning you will have to read everything you see.

While I have not personally experienced the multiplayer, I have heard that -Revelator- has some of the best balance. As said though, if you wish to play competitively, you will need to gradually switch off of Stylish and learn all the moves and combos to really enjoy it.

Pros: Good Multiplayer, 2 Single Player Modes, Stylish moveset for new players, technical for veteran players, one of best albums in gaming, beautiful looking game, probably the best story as far as fighting games go.

Cons: non-interactive story (a con for some), very high learning curve if not using stylish, competitive stylish is impossible, must read all dialogue to appreciate story

I would recommend this game to hardcore fighters who just want a solid fighting game, but can also recommend it to player's wanting a fighting game they can play single player, especially if they haven't yet learned fighting game mechanics.

If the price goes down, such as a discount, I would even recommend it for the story alone. Though you will also need -Sign- to get the entire story!

30480762.review:
Ok, so before I start, let me make one thing unmistakably clear: YOU DO NOT HAVE TO HAVE GODLIKE EXECUTION TO BE GOOD AT THIS GAME. Guilty Gear is a game about spacial awareness, about knowing your opponent, about doing the right thing at the right time. None of these things are Combo Video-level execution. GET THIS INTO YOUR HEAD. I play Pot, okay? I can't do 6K loops to save my life. My motor abilities rival those of a trained orangutan. And yet, I still win matches. It can be done, people.

Alright, with that out of the way: This game is the full package. Deep, nucanced, fast-paced, balanced for fun and yet every character is 100% tournament viable. The amount of mechanical freedom you're given can be overwhelming at first, but once everything clicks, the battlefield becomes a canvas that you paint on. If you like you express yourself through your playstyle, look no further. No two Kys play quite the same, no two Slayers play quite the same. Every Millia plays like an asshole, but still, you feel the little differences from player to player. I guarantee you.

And Xrd rewards good reads like almost no other fighting game does. Every tool has a clear counter, and every counter can be baited. Hell, you have about five different options from blockstun alone. And nobody expects you to learn all of these from day 1 onwards. But what you have to understand is that playing this game is a learning process pretty much all the way through. There is no shame in burning all your meter on Faultless Defense, just like there are no "optimal" ways to play your Character.  There aren't even real optimal combo routes most of the time. Instead, you will find yourself observing your position on the screen and adjusting your punishes accordingly. If you're coming from Street Fighter V, where frame data is everything, this will absolutely blow your mind at first. But again, when you're finally starting to get it, you will wonder how a sterile, mathematical system like the one in SFV can even be considered "fighting", really.

Finally, this game is absolutely breathtaking, on both a technical and an artistic level. If you even have a passing interest in 3D-modelling, this is the absolute cream of the crop. Character models morph and smear, with multiple shaders giving the game an impression if having animated 2D-Sprites. Occasionally, the game pans around the action to remind you that, no, these are actually 3D models, and they look fan-fucking-tastic. The same can be said for the soundtrack, with Hard Rock and Metal riffs blasting trhough your speakers. J-Metal might not be everyone's cup of tea and it certainly isn't mine, usually. But Revelator remains one of the few fighting games where I still listen to the soundtrack instead of my own playlist.

I mean, yeah, it's kind of expensive for an impulse buy, I get it. But look at me: I just wrote a 500-word essay on this game. And you read it, apparently (thanks, by the way). Here's the deal: I spent about 200 hours in SFV before I realized I just wasn't enjoying myself like I hoped I would. I am having *fun* in Xrd, more than I ever had in the Street Fighters. That's all I care about. Buy this game, you won't regret it.

29973920.review:
Writing from EU West:
this game has everything it needs to be a good fighting game (nice graphics, awesome looking characters with various play strategy), an arcade mode where the AI is kinda tough but makeable since they recalibrate the AI level depending on your skill and some other modes that are quite satisfying to play.

quite enjoyable the most of the time but if you are new to fighting games you will have some hard time getting used to the speedy playstyle of guilty gear (mostly trying to figure out what the hell is going on and what in the gods name you have to do)

and mostly i would really not recommend you playing online (as long as you are not confident in your skill in millisecond thinking) since the players mostly consist of veteran players who will beat the hell out of you and probably bore you very quickly. The match making just takes a look on the character level and not an actual player level (it depends on that "one specific character" he played and does not state the general status of the player. so they can simply pick another character they didn't play that much and brutally slay beginners).

but as i said it takes time to get used to the controls and all the "fighting game knowledge" it's just the multi-player which should give the beginners fair chance to learn about this game just bites the dust.

oh, and yeah the story mode is not actual gameplay but you just sit there and watch an 4 hours and half long anime movie which is quite entertaining when you want to watch some anime. 

Still good game has got nice waifus and keeps entertaining you as long as you stay away from that multiplayer mode

Verdict:
If you are confident in your skill and familiar with the Guilty Gear Series (OR just want to get some time killing game including an anime movie of 4 hours and half playtime) then a BIG YES

Else if you are looking for a good fighting game to play online then rather NO (except you really don't care about that)

29968506.review:
LET'S TRIGGER FANBOYS WITH SOME TRUTHS:
- Lack of player base on PC since there is no cross-play.
- Bad Ranked matches system, already dead, people still skip it cause its badly done.
- They say the netcode is better but actually its the same with SIGN and reality is its just ok. Not good, not great...Just ok..
- People say the ''world dollar'' system is awesome but here's the truth about it: In SIGN you had every colors unlocked from the begining,right? In revelator you need that ''World Dollars'' to unlock the existed same colors.
- No alternate costumes. Same colors.
- No English dubs btw. Almost all chars are non-japanese but they are trying to speak Eng.  This is like having Japanese version of Dante only for DMC or Umvc3.
- If you dont like guitar solos you wont like the music this game has.
- Really small buffer times will give you cancer.
- The gameplay itself is attack-only oriented. Very friendly for spammers.
- Best defensive option is to keep mashing HS so if opponent screws up his combo, you'll get a throw.
- Punishes are non-existed. When your opponent whiff, the best option you have is just jump and gtfo there so you can attack.
- At least graphics are better than SIGN. Way better actually. Backgrounds or new lightinings and shadows on models etc.

If those are not problems to you, then enjoy it.

29946977.review:
Rev 2 Update:
The Rev 2 update will be coming soon as a $20 DLC update, and if Rev 2 is your first outing to the Guilty Gear series, it'll cost somewhere between $40-50.  I'll post more on that later when it comes out June 1st, but Rev 2 will have a LOT of new features.

The training mode, stylish mode (easier control scheme for beginners) and FAQs are still there, so the game will still help newcomers to the series git gud, but not only that, there will be beginner restricted lobbies that'll keep higher leveled players out so beginners and casual players can enjoy playing the game in relative peace.

Other new lobby features include network colors (up or down arrows of various colors to indicate the level of a player's skill in relation to yours), three win cabinets (where players can go best of three matches in the center of the lobby), and treasure chests (which give you random prizes from the gallery, much like fishing, except they can only be opened once daily).

Seriously, every time Guilty Gear Xrd releases a new update, there's more and more reasons to play it.

Source:
http://gematsu.com/2017/04/guilty-gear-xrd-rev-2-pc-launches-june-1-online-lobbies-detailed

Original Review:
Guilty Gear Xrd -REVELATOR- improves on everything -SIGN- brought to the table,  Blitz shields can now be held for a (blockable) stagger attack, which can even be used in some combos.  The game's still pretty high execution, but some chraacters are easier to play than others.  I'm a Chipp main, so the struggle to git gud is real.  Still, I love how much this game pushes its players.  But don't worry if you're new to fighting games, the tutorial's got you covered, mission mode teaches game mechanics and tips the tutorial doesn't, and combo mode teaches you character specific moves and combos.

Online is more populated than -SIGN- was on Steam because now it's up to date with the console release (until Rev 2 comes out, anyway), and there's people of all skill levels playing at any given time.  There are a lot of people who are REALLY good at the game who you'll probably run into, but there are some beginners as well.

But if you bought the game, and the tutorials, missions and combo modes aren't enough enough to teach you everything you want to know (and they do kinda leave out a few things), check out the Guilty Gear Crash Course on YouTube, dustloop forums or the Guilty Gear Discord channel.  I'll post those at the end of my review in a resources section.

Pros:
The game's cast is extremely diverse, every character has a different fighting style.
The in-game track selection now includes songs from the vocal collection (as well as vocal versions of songs from previous games in the franchise).
Fishing lets you obtain random unlockables pretty cheap, but you'll get a lot of fish (but every 10 fish you get gives you a new unlockable!).
The game gives you so many options at all times.  Once you get a feel for what you can do, situationally, you'll find yourself improving dramatically.  The more time and effort you put into the game, the more it gives back.
If you get exhausted from mission, combo or online modes, play the story mode (recommended if you completed -SIGN-'s story mode (the order of events go -SIGN- arcade mode, -SIGN- story mode, -REVELATOR- episode mode (basically just arcade mode again) and -REVELATOR- story mode.  I really CAN'T stress how good the game's story is.  I have friends who haven't watched it yet and I'm all like "DO IT!"  Seriously, it's so good.

Cons:
The execution barrier and skill of high level players can be intimidating to new players who hop online and suddenly get bodied, BUT DON'T GIVE UP!  And remember to have fun.
They did nerf reversal timing from -SIGN-, so if you really want to do a reversal, you have to wait longer.  But it's better to just block on your wakeup.  Reversals are that bad now.

Resources:
Guilty Gear Crash Course: https://www.youtube.com/playlist?list=PLj34EySs1IeZ8GpjKW8R2T6dzI6B3GSuH
Guilty Gear Forums: http://www.dustloop.com/forums/index.php?/forums/
Discord Server: https://discord.gg/Xrh8MYV
High Level Replays: https://keeponrock.in

Guide: http://steamcommunity.com/sharedfiles/filedetails/?id=1117790766
I recently started writing a guide to Guilty Gear guides here on Steam 'cuz I was tired of dumping tons of links on new players.  Now I can just dump one link with tons of other links inside it!

29937165.review:
对于我这种小时候格斗游戏只接触过拳皇街霸的玩家，第一次见到罪恶装备也是在xrd sign出来时才认识到这个历史悠久的系列。
1：画风精美，这种3D做出的伪2D风格十分有特点，一局游戏下来就像看番剧。
2：人设优秀，个性鲜明的人物加上一人一战斗系统，使游戏中的的角色更有存在感，令人留下深刻印象。
3：剧情内容丰富，有自己的世界观，加上内置的故事模式让动漫迷也能过足瘾，甚至有点不务正业。
4：可玩性多，相比其他格斗游戏来说，本作在单人模式下可玩的内容更加丰富，有趣且全面的新手教程，使其对新人更加友好。
5：罪恶装备系列的音乐非常棒，强烈推荐各位玩家在自己的音乐播放器上收藏本游戏的原声音乐集。
6：本系列的战斗系统相对复杂，如果是没有任何格斗游戏经验的话，需要大量的学习成本。
  本作身为格斗游戏的素质肯定是一流水准，但是最大的不足就是国内知名度不高，导致多人对战的体验并不是很好，如果有基友互怼的话，能找回儿时的乐趣，我认为这款游戏是非常严重的冷门神作，（没错，非常严重）当下并不是格斗游戏的最好的时代，不过作为最传统，最纯粹的游戏类型，我相信不久的将来，终会迎来春天。

29852927.review:
Guilty Gear Xrd -REVELATOR- รีวิว

ต้องออกตัวก่อนเลยว่าผม"เคย"เป็นคนที่เล่นเกมแนว Fighting ไม่เป็นแต่อยากฝึกเล่นก็เลยเลือกที่จะหยิบเกมนี้มานะครับ โดยที่ไม่รู้ว่าเกมนี้ขึ้นขื่อว่าเป็นเกมแนว Fighting ที่หินพอๆกับ Tekken เลย (ฮา) 

ถึงแม้ระบบ Combo จะไม่ได้กดยากมากมาย แต่ระบบของเกมนี้นั้นเยอะมาก รวมถึง Timing ในการกดนั้นค่อนข้างที่จะต้องเป๊ะถึงจะติดทำให้เล่นยากพอควรเลย ส่วนเกมนี้นั้นถ้าเทียบกับ BlazBlue Combo ของเกมนี้จะน้อยกว่านะครับ แต่ก็ไม่ได้ง่ายไปกว่ากัน 

ระบบ Tutorial ของเกมนี้นั้นออกแบบมาค่อนข้างดีเลยนะครับ เข้าใจง่าย แถมสนุกด้วย นี่ยังไม่พูดถึงเนื้อเรื่องที่สนุกมากๆ ให้อารมณ์เหมือนดูอนิเมแต่จะหนักไปที่บทสนทนามากกว่าฉาก Action นะครับฉะนั้นปะกิดต้องแข็งพอตัวเลย โดยจะดำเนินเนื้อเรื่องแบบ Visual Novel (No Choices) 

ข้อดี
-เนื้อเรื่องสนุก มีการเล่าเรื่องของภาคก่อนถึงจะไม่เคยเล่นแต่ก็เข้าใจได้ชัดเจน
-Tutorial ที่สนุก และง่ายต่อการเรียน
-มี Content ในเกมที่ผมกล้าพูดว่าเยอะมาก
-มี Sound Track ที่ดีมากโดยผมยกให้เป็นอันดับ 2 รองมาจาก Persona 4 เลย
-Gameplay สนุก แต่ละตัวละครมีไสตล์การเล่นที่ต่างกันอย่างเห็นได้ชัด และใช้ฝีมือมากๆ (มีโหมด Stylish สำหรับคนฝึกเล่นด้วย แค่กดปุ่มโจมตีจะต่อ combo ให้เอง)
-Design ตัวละครดูดีมาก ออกไสตล์อนิเมเก่าๆ (ส่วนตัวผมชอบ BlazBlue มากกว่า ฮ่าๆ)
-มี Ref เกี่ยวกับเพลงแนว Metal อยู่ตรึม แฟนๆเพลง Metal น่าจะชอบ

ข้อเสีย
-เกมอนิเมะทำให้คนเล่นน้อยครับ :'(


โดยส่วนตัวแล้วผมมองว่าเกมนี้เป็นเกมที่คุ้มจะซื้อมากๆ โดยถ้าคนไหนสนใจจะซื้อเกมนี้ หรือซื้อมาแล้วหาเพื่อนเล่นด้วยสามารถ add ผมมาได้เลยนะครับ และตอนนี้ทางเราได้ทำการจัดกลุ่มเกมแนว Anime Fighting กันด้วย ผู้ที่สนใจมาแจมได้เลยนะครับ

29692258.review:
길티 기어 시리즈를 본작으로 처음 접한 사람으로서 평가를 내리자면,
필자가 플레이한 "울트라 스트리트 파이터 4"에 비해 상당한 난이도를 요구한다.
철권이나 스파같이 "뭐 다른 격겜이랑 차이가 있겠어?"한다면 오산.

다른 격겜과는 다르게 일단 튜토리얼이 있다. 여기부터 뭔가 범상치가 않다.
무릇 격겜이라 함은 먼저 주먹과 발부터 내지르는 것으로 첫 걸음을 떼는 것이 아니던가.

아니나 다를까 무슨 씨X 튜토리얼 주제에 오지게 어렵다.
처음 튜토리얼 시작할 때 나오는 키레이한 잭 오쨩의 목소리와 와꾸에 숨을 거칠게 내쉬던 오덕변태인간말종도
튜토리얼 끝날때 쭘 잭확찢을 시전하고 싶을 것이다.
일단 뭐 슬래쉬 더스트 나부랭이는 그렇다 쳐도
무슨 캔슬? 그것 때문에 난이도가 수직상승한다.
울스파에서도 세이빙 캔슬 하나때문에 목숨줄이 왔다갔다 하는 와중에
이 게임은 무려 캔슬 키를 하나 집어 넣어줬다.
씨X

그러나 그것도 잠시, 좆같음과 분노를 이겨내고 먼저 AI전에 돌입한 순간
튜토리얼의 암따위는 깨끗이 사라진다.
쩔어주는 일렉기타의 싸운-드와 지려버리는 이-펙트에 
분노는 눈 녹듯 사라지졌으며 난 바지적삼을 적시고 하기스 매직팬티 한 박스를 꺼내야 했다.

스토리 모드는 그냥 애니 한편 보는 기분이라 챕터 1만 보고 안하고 있는데 격겜치고 엄청나게 탄탄한 스토리라인이다.
미시마 집안 막장 가족사가 전부인 철권이나 배경설정 정도가 스토리라인의 전부인 스파와는 비교를 불허한다.

맞다 지금 존나 주관적으로 쓰고 있다

또 AI전 난이도 낮게 잡아놓고 일격필살기 꽂아서 연출 보는 것도 한 재미 한다.

아직 출시된지 얼마 지나지도 않았고 가격의 압박 때문인지 멀티는 사람이 졸라리 적은 편이긴 하나
캐릭터 한명씩 다 골라잡아서 연습하고 에피소드 한번씩만 돌려도 더럽게 재밌다
무엇보다 금혜현이 예쁘고 쿠라도베리 바스트 모핑이 씹오짐 하앍
결론은 사라 두번 사라

29642151.review:
Easily, this is the best fighting game out there right now. I would highly recommend this game to anyone into anime styled games or fighting games in general. 

Pros:
-Amazing action game-like tutorials
-Specific matchup practice
-Second to none aesthetics
-Large roster full of unique characters
-One of the most amazing video game soundtracks to bless my ears
-Easy to pick up mechanics and basic fundamentals
-It's still being updated
-It's not Street Fighter V

Cons:
-Matchmaking could use some work
-The community is not as big as it should be
-$50 is a lot considering you can get this game on PS4 for $20
-DLC is pretty expensive, $5 for each character
-This game is developed by Arc System Works, so they'll make a new one every year, making you buy another $60 release and rendering this game obsolete

Overall, I think this game is a welcome addition to anyone's library. There's plenty of single player content, but this game really shines if you have at least one friend to play with. Although, definitely wait for a sale.

29620776.review:
Do you like fighting games? 
Do you like flashy animations?
Are you absolutely garbage at fighting games in general? 

If any of these apply, then you should most definitely get yourself a copy of this game. 

GG Revelator slaps you in the face with intuitive combat mechanics, great character designs, and one hell of a tutorial system. No, seriously. It's the best fighting game tutorial you'll find nowadays. It covers the basic and advanced fundamentals of combat mechanics, movement / positioning, and character matchups. This game is extremely welcome to beginner and veteran players alike. 

You're getting a pretty fair amount of content for $50, especially if you've never bought the previous version, Guilty Gear Xrd Sign. Either way, this game is fantastic and should be in the library of anyone that enjoys fighting games.

29579298.review:
Best fighter out on the market atm. Game revolves around okizeme and each character plays vastly different from one another. Matchups matter because each character has such varied normals that you find yourself playing your character in ways you don't normally think you would depending on the matchup and how high a skill level you're playing in.

Game has a lot of options on offense thanks to cancelling anything at any time with meter and provides options on defense and forces you to learn to block and look for opportunities due to how fast the game can be. A good fighter to get into once you have some fundementals down after playing Street Fighter.

Arcsys has always done that thing where they balance and add a few new characters to the game with each iteration but charge damn near full price. Not any different here. It's slightly justified in that each iteration always moves the story forward for anyone that cares for that sort of thing. Given that the story mode is done with the game engine and how it's hours long it's slightly justified. You've also got a lot of bonus features in the periphery, such as a slightly adjusted and upgraded graphical engine, inclusion of more music, a new statue mode where you can pose the character models and take pics, which is pretty cool. It's a lot of incremental additions that make me think this game would be fine at the 30 dollar range. 

They've already announced revelator 2 for the spring, and given Arcsys record of delay with releasing games on PC I'd say it'll be here sometime in the summer and/or early fall, given how Arcsys said it'll be a downloadable upgrade to the base game. Don't know how they'll handle it on PC but it's pretty clear Arcsys' old model of game releases is stuck in the past and needs some tuning. 

Beyond all of that the game is fantastic and given how matchups matter and how each character plays real different you'll be spending an assload of time trying to get your character down just right. It took me over 100 hours on the first game getting the game down and practicing Axl, and given how my main for Rev (Johnny) is all situational and pressure oriented it'll probably be 100 hours more.

Also, as of this writing (February 2017) the online is surprisingly alive and well. I never have any issues finding multiple rooms with people to fight.

My leaving tip of advice is this: don't get discouraged. If you go online you're gonna get raped, and you're gonna be confused at the outset given how this is possibly the most complicated fighter out on the market at the moment. Trust me; we were all shit. Some people are coming in from the old GG's so they have a good foundation, but everyone was shit at one point. Hell I'm ass at Johnny atm, but at the very least I have a good foundation on the game and do well with Axl. 

Point is if you're not a casual (I don't mean that as an insult) and want a good fighter to sink time into this is it. You'll most likely get raped for the first month, but if you commit to it damn is it fun. It's the difference between doing real world street racing and playing mario kart; one is easier and instant gratification cause it's so simple, the other has a hurdle you gotta get over, but once you do you have so much more fun because there's so much more going on.

29495791.review:
20170719
1、surface pro4 i7 16g HD540(I7的核显与NEW SURFACE PRO的核显性能一样)在不插电的情况 开720P 调最低可以满60FPS 但是比较耗电，看来WIN笔记本玩游戏什么的还是要插电啊，都怪英特尔这个牙膏厂！
---------------------------------------------------------------------
看到更新了简体中文就果断入手了，翻译质量还是不错的，绝对不是机翻。日厂里少有的认真好好做PC游戏的，绝对不是卡婊（街霸5半成品）、脱裤狂魔（死或生嘲讽PC玩家）这些渣渣能比的，简直良心。

-----------------------------
+画面
1、相比上一代和苍翼默示录系列而言画面有大幅度的提升，狗牙几乎看不到了。希望苍翼默示录系列也能出个3D画面的哟。
2、时时生成的动画简直好评！看番玩游戏
3、角色配色很多都好丑啊，能不能来一些淡的亮色？
4、其实我不怎么喜欢角色上的黑边
+打击感
1、比上一代打击感要好一些，特别是连招的时候流畅了很多呢
2、招式还是有些少能，要是像苍翼默示录系列那样四个方向对应每个键位都有不同招式就好了
+优化
1、满60FPS全程，在最高抗锯齿+768P+窗口
2、在4K屏幕下，win10 64专业版 设置1080P的窗口时，会黑屏有声音，只能通过重新安装游戏才能解决
3、开最高抗锯齿，战斗结束后有画面撕裂现象，希望能优化下
4、键位设置这次很不错呢，PC依旧可以自由修改键位比卡婊好了很多
--------------------吐槽—————————————————
1、不能使用存档了呢，这点很不开心啊，其实像苍翼默示录系列那样在线存档与平时的存档分离就行了。
2、角色还是太少了啊~~~多出点吧
3、背景音乐有些吵

29486043.review:
发现更新了中文，于是我立马看完番特来评测一发。
虽然本人是个手残，但却很喜欢arc制作的两个系列的格斗游戏，罪恶装备可以看番，苍翼默示录可以玩galgame。。
最新的启示者和神观之梦本来都是打算入ps4版的，不过既然厂商很有诚意地在steam上打算都推出中文版，再考虑价格和dlc，当然还是steam版更实惠了。
从剧情和世界观上来说，我个人觉得，游戏最吸引人的地方就是剧情里那些充满特点而又活灵活现的角色人物，操作他们对战时，又会觉得很帅很有型(*^_^*)。纵观整个故事还是有那么些许中二的，不过对角色有爱就完全没问题咯，再加上动画制作精良，各种大牌cv，所以如果是日呆的话，肯定也会很满足。。。
真正核心的格斗游戏不是我的强项，我想比较关注和喜爱格斗游戏的童鞋基本上应该也都听说过罪恶装备吧。就简单说两句，上手难度感觉还是blz比gg要简单啊。。。真羡慕那些大神。。。以后有空慢慢玩吧。
最后顺便提一下，简体中文字体看着比较舒服和习惯，但是稍微有些错字，繁体中文我看下来好像没有问题。还有一点小遗憾，就是似乎没有分辨率选项，不过默认的画面也足够可以了。
期待启示者2，继续支持。

更新：感谢网友提醒，原来调分辨率和全屏的选项放在一起了，我之前才没发现。。

Guilty gear Xrd Revelator is the newest game made by Arc systems works the same developers as Blazblue.  As 2D fighting games go I have to give all credit to Arc systems works for pushing the limits and pushing between art and gaming. As a fighting game goes it's easy to pick up but harder to master.  Arc systems works have put in a tutorial/dojo mode that goes in depth and is one of the better tutorial modes I have seen within a fighting game.

Guilty gear Xrd Revelator also has a diverse cast of characters  Axl low to  Jack -O all feeling unique Story mode feels like you are watching a movie that is very well animated  and polished  the only thing I can say that is negative is that the online play sometimes feels lacking when hardly no one plays online but that might change and even then it has a throwback to the arcade days is it worth the pick up? My answer is yes pick it up

29362406.review:
Pros:
1: Fantastic graphics that succeed in creating the faux-2D efffect that developers of cel-shaded games have been trying & failing to do for decades; a noteable achievement that perhaps will mark the standard of future anime-styled games.
2: Engaging story & universe full of pure awesome style and a rich legacy in fighting game history.
3: Loveable characters with vibrant, deep personalities.
4: Simple, accessible gameplay that allows for anyone to get into it, while retaining some complexity for the hardcore crowd.

Cons:
No English dub, unlike -SIGN-, so you have to put up with awful, unfitting Japanese voices screeching & growling in your ears. Fortunately, you can turn the voices off in the settings, and just work off the subtitles.

29238684.review:
Awesome game, great port. There's a perfect balance between casual play and competitive play due to having the choice between stylish mode and technical mode. A wide variety of tutorials and trials that show you how to input stuff when you're at loss of how to do things, a great amount of tips are also provided. Basically, they did everything to help you improve without erasing the overall difficulty level of the game, which is something Street Fighter is doing with their new patches. You have a big pool of awesome characters to choose from. Seriously, when going through story mode, I liked every fucking character because they're so well designed and well fleshed out. As for online play, everything is very well organized. There's no problem with the netcode as long as you play with someone from your region. I recommend playing player matches mainly, since you'll have a hard time finding ranked matches depending on your region (I'm from EU). You can join rooms and go to training mode in them even, but the great part is that you can play lots of games without waiting (which pisses me off about SFV queue). 

Overall, 9/10 it's all right

29180040.review:
Jogo de luta excelente. Jogo Guilty Gear desde o Missing Link para PSX e foi o jogo de luta que me inseriu no cenario competitivo.

Ponto positivo vai obviamente para a trilha sonora. Gosto muito da OST da serie Accent Core, mas as musicas do Sign e Revelator tambem sao muito boas. Vale ressaltar que o Revelator disponibiliza a OST de todos os jogos da serie, inclusive do Guilty Gear Isuka (uma das melhores trilhas na minha opiniao).

Os personagens sao carismaticos, criativos e unicos. Cada um possui um gameplay muito peculiar e grande potencial de vitoria, o que torna o jogo bastante balanceado e cheio de possibilidades. Acho que isso era mais evidente na serie Accent Core, visto que o Sign e Revelator foram produzidos sob uma otica mais amigavel para atrair novos jogadores.

Meu unico ponto "negativo" com relacao a serie eh a dificuldade em se tornar um bom jogador. Eh um jogo complexo e com curva de aprendizado nao muito amigavel. Chegar ao ponto em que o jogo fica divertido por voce dominar a movimentacao frenetica e os combos estilosos, podendo se equiparar competitivamente com outros jogadores relativamente experientes, eh muito motivador. Mas passar disso para entender o jogo a fundo, em que situacoes fazer qual tipo de jogada e tudo isso dentro de intervalos curtos de tempo (pois o jogo eh rapido e agressivo) pode ser frustrante a principio e levar um tempo ate que o jogador se acostume com a ideia.

Isso era bem evidente na serie Accent Core e anteriores. Agora com a serie XRD o jogo esta um pouco mais facilitado, entao nao eh tao dificil se tornar um player destacavel no ranking, em campeonatos ou mesmo em jogatinas casuais. O que pode ser um ponto frustrante para jogadores old school da serie, mas no geral eh bem vantajoso devido a grande playerbase que o jogo tem atraido, alem do proprio destaque do jogo em grandes torneios como a EVO.

Resumindo, o jogo eh muito bonito, OST fantastica, personagens legais, criativos e variados. Eh muito satisfatorio dominar as mecanicas e combos, possibilitando fazer jogadas estilosas e bonitas. Apesar da curva de aprendizado ainda ser relativamente elevada, todo jogador de jogos de luta que simpatize com air dashers deveria dar uma espiada em Guilty Gear! =)

28988552.review:
オススメしたくないけどオススメしたいゲーム

正直な所、前作と殆ど変わった部分は無いと思う。
新キャラ追加と溜めブリッツの追加。それに加えて各種キャラクターの調整。
それでいて、CS版から半年遅れでこの値段は正直高い。
特に1キャラしか使わない人に取っては可哀想だな。と思う部分もある。
マルチプラットフォームは厳しいのは解ってはいたので
もし次回作が出るのならば、せめて同時発売でお願いしたい所である。

・対戦環境
ロビーが進化。したのだが、追加されたサッカーも最初は目新しいものの
正直な話、チャットしている時に溜めキックされると会話の邪魔でしかならない。
サッカーOFFモードを付けて欲しい。
チャット部分に関してもかなり劣化していて、前作がエンターキー1発で押せたのを今回はメニュー画面から開かないと行けない。
(キーボードのI→Uである程度省略化は出来る）
この辺は慣れるしか無いのかな？と。
ランクマッチは前作と殆ど変わらないけど、
プレイヤーマッチの再戦機能が進化していて前作と違いロード時間がかなり短縮されている
が、基本的に野良で立っている部屋は勝ち残り設定なので身内とやらない限り殆ど意味が無いと思う。
という訳で、ぶっちゃけ前作と一緒で良かったんじゃね？と思った

・実績

とりあえず全実績解除達成。
（後々追加される予定らしい）ロビー関係のバッジが一切取れないので
現状では恐らく最後に残るであろう「聖騎士勲章」の実績が結構辛い。
逆に前作ではMOM関係が時間が掛かったのだが、今回は数時間程度のプレイでMOM関連は終わることが出来る。
聖騎士勲章はバッジ150種類獲得で取得できるんだけど、
自分はランクマッチ450戦程で取得できた。
販売直後のスタートダッシュ＋レッドバッジ2種類でこれなので、
時間が経てば経つほど取得するのは厳しくなると思う。
このレビューを書いてる現在で、実績フルコンプしたのは自分しか居ないハズ


割りと酷評だった気はするが
やはりプレイしてみると楽しい。
発売して半月ほどで500戦＋1100戦やってる時点でおかしい気もするけど
それだけ対戦が楽しいと言うことなんだろう
今回はチュートリアルモードも前作以上に充実していて
より簡単に対戦に挑めると思う。
トレモしてボコられてトレモしてボコられて強くなろう。
その先に、きっと勝利が待っている筈だ

28976181.review:
You can kill people by slamming doors in their face!
Now that that is out of my system the reason why I recommend this game.

First of this is a good pc port from an options perspective (can't compare performance, so not commenting on that). You can rebind all keys and the game acknowledges your changes.
Say you rebind punch and kick and you start the tutorial. By default the moves will show up as P (punch) or K (kick), but in the options menu you can change that to either xbox controller prompts or keyboard prompts and it will show the keys you bound to the attacks.

The tutorial is really extensive and goes over the generic basics and also character specific combo's. When starting out with the character specific combo training the game will show 2 fighting sticks in the middle of the screen. One is the example and the other is your input. This helps when trying to figure out what to do and if you don't fully get it that way you can still go to the options menu and watch an example of what you are supposed to do by letting an AI do it for you.

There is also a lot of style in this game. Some attacks start a really small animation where you for instance smash your opponent into the air and then the camera returns to the regular 2D view. What I first thought was "This can be annoying when trying to combo.", but it surprisingly isn't since the animation is short and you instantly get control back after it.

There are also 2 forms of story mode.
One is a sort of prelogue to the actual story. In this story mode you fight opponents and get a bit of story at the start and end of some of the fights. When completing the prelogue of a character you unlock more colours for said character.
The "real" story mode is an entire movie about the game's story. I haven't viewed it yet since I like a some  action in fighting games, but it is a really cool idea and from the short bit that I saw in the first chapter the art style is up to par with the game itself.

Besides the story modes and tutorials there is also a versus mode where you fight the AI head on like you would a human opponent. I would call the AI good since I have some real difficulty with normal, but it is still do-able. There is of course an only mode, but this is something I also haven't played so I can't comment on that part of the game.
Finally there is a special mode called M.O.M. where you fight the AI in normal versus matches, but you earn medals every time you beat your opponent. These medals allow you to buy items etc. The fights in this mode are more tense than regular vs matches, because you 1 have a timer and 2 need to beat your opponent 3 times in a single fight if you want to win. This also makes the mode quite hard, so it offers a good challenge.

The fighters all feel different. When playing something like Jack'O you place spawners on the ground that pop out minions that attack your opponent. When playing Fause you can teleport and smash doors into the face of your opponent. Dizzy uses spells to attack opponents at range with a lot of damage. Venom is a fighter that spread biliard balls and shoots them at his opponent, and the list just goes on.
The point is they all feel completely different. This is something I missed in for example Street Fighter where the differences between characters are sometimes really small or they can just be ignored.

A small extra in the game is a diorama mode where you can place fighters you have unlocked in different poses with different colours on one of up to 5 "plates" (2 large plates that can fit 2 fighters and 3 smaller ones that fit 1).

With every fight you get more ingame currency which allows you to go fish. Fishing is something that allows you to unlock things for your player card and diorama mode. This is a really basic thing, but it is something slightly different, presentation-wise, then the graveyard from Mortal Kombat.

What would I like to see? Something like the random mutator mode from MK, because playing with friends can be unbalanced if you know how to play and they don't. Besides that it is also fun to play vs AI sometimes where you or they can be randomly buffed or handicapped.
And more fighters of course, but what's there is amazing and they all fight in a different way.

28856399.review:
Note: I just got this today, and am speaking with one days worth of experience in XRD. 

Ok, where do I even begin with this game. This is a work of art and is a must have for any fighting game fan. I almost delayed my purchase a few months to get it on sale, and boy am I glad I didn't. This game is a blast to play, and if you enjoy fighting games, there is a good chance you'll have fun with this.

Now for the bad news, this game is hard. Like, the most difficult fighting game I've played besides street fighter 4(I'll never be able to get over the combo system in that game, but that's another story). If you are new to fighting games, i'd recommend this game because it's great, but I'd recommend a game like Under Night In-Birth EXE Late more than this. The reason being though this game does have an outstanding tutorial, it's a very high entry barrier compared to UNIEL and UNIEL will make beginners feel like they are having fun and doing well. Guilty Gear will make you feel like you suck and need to stop trying. I have been playing fighting games for several years, and have been playing seriously for about 6-9 months and it is still difficult for me to learn this game. While I feel I will start to get the hang of things within a few weeks of playing, beginners will not have that luxury. If you do not plan to get good or play online, set the bots to easy, play the story, and then decide if you want to get better. You'll probably like the game more that way, and the story alone is probably worth the money. If you to plan to play competitively, please bring a buddy along with you. You will get dominated by Japanese players who have lived most of their lives with guilty gear in the arcade if you do not. 

Now for my overall review. The tutorial system is fantastic. The art is top notch. The mechanics are easy to learn, but hard to master. The character design is outstanding. And finally, the soundtrack will melt your ears right off. The game's mix of anime and metal works quite nicely and the game is quite enjoyable. Probably the best fighting game on steam currently. Possibly the best feature of this game though is not having 6 frames of lag or installing rootkits(cough SFV cough). Definitely worth every penny, and your money helps arcsys make even more amazing fighting games.

TLDR: Possibly best fighting game, just be prepared to suck until you put the hours into it. Also, play with friends for the most fun.

EDIT/LONG RANT AFTER THE REVIEW: I have put several more hours into this game, and can safely say it is easier to get used to than I expected. The game feels very much like Blazblue, but different in ways that I actually prefer. Overdrive cancels are done with Roman Cancels(basically no wasting burst) and the the Dust button is always a welcome addition. As one of my friends put it, it is somewhere in between Skullgirls and Blazblue. Even though it doesn't inherently feel anything like Skullgirls at the surface level, there are similarities. Do I still prefer other games for beginners? Absolutely, but still play Guilty Gear. If you are unsure what fighting game to buy, like I said before, Under Night In-Birth EXE Late is half the price of this and is the easiest anime fighter I have played. I would also recommend Skullgirls, which is half the price of UNIEL and while not as simple, is way easier than guilty gear and will at least prepare you for longer combos than Guilty Gear has to offer. I cannot stress enough. Find a friend/sparring partner and practice. Practice is really the only way to "git gud" and though the journey is long and the climb is steep, you will see progress and it will drive you to get better. So, if you are up to the task, buy this game. If you are unsure, buy Skullgirls or UNIEL. In the case of Skullgirls, it's single player is fantastic and 2nd encore allows you to learn combos in a similar fasion to the Guilty Gear combo training.

28817869.review:
Hello readers. I'm back again to review a title that I am quite fond of. Guilty Gear Xrd Revelator. This is an update to Guilty Gear Xrd Sign that came out last year, and while it may not add 5,000 metric tons of saucy content that fans might be expecting, the fact is that this game is one of the finest fighting games IN EXISTENCE.

For newcomers to the fighting game genre, Guilty Gear can be a bit daunting, like going 12 rounds against Godzilla in a Primetime Heavyweight Boxing match for the grand title. But never fear newcomers. Revelator sports one of the finest tutorials in all of fighting games. They teach you all the mechanics from moving your character to even performing basic option selects. Isn't that just wonderful?

As far as new content in Revelator, there are some worthwhile additions to know about. Most notable are new characters Johnny, Jack-O, Jam, Raven, Haehyun, and Dizzy. All of them look great in action AS TO BE EXPECTED. The entire game has received new shading graphical stuff that makes the game look even more impressive if that's even possible. Needless to say, this is my pick for best looking fighting game of all time. It's like 3d models made to look like 2d sprites and it's just beautiful madness. And the soundtrack? The sound track is jamming. Dozens of delicious rock tracks, new and old from past games, make this OST an exciting barbeque rib platter that always keeps you coming back for more. 

One thing that needs to be mentioned are the lightning fast load times. Compared to games like Street Fighter 5, and even the PS4 version of Revelator, the load times in this are top tier quaility. It takes no time at all to start match after match and, for fighter enthusiasts who will be grinding on this game for days to come, you will appreciate this.

So let's talk about the core gameplay itself. How would I describe it in one word? Dynamic, Saucetastic, Gratifying, Elegant, Gorilla, Off-the-Backboard Dunk, and Crusher Ball. Any one of those words would suffice. The gameplay is incredibly deep with many, many different universal mechanics to learn. Things like Roman Cancels and Burst keep you invloved at all times and with so many ways to use resources, the depth of this game is like the a deep sea ocean trench covered in an eternal darkness that beckons to swallow any unfortunate soul who wanders too close to its saucy aroma.

The characters all have great designs and very different playstyles. Most characters have a defining trait or mechanic that makes it quite the endeavor just to learn one character in this game. It rewards practice and creativity, AND I LIKE THAT. Any fighting game fan will appreciate the originality and depth that the gameplay and characters bring to the table.

At the end of the day, if you are fan of fighters, this is a game that you should literally have in your shopping cart at this very moment. If your wallet isn't in your hand right this minute ready to make a transaction leading to your ownership of this title, than I would suggest you take steps toward that end. It's got sublime music, top of the line graphics and visuals, and a fighting game system that rivals any other. This is one philly cheese steak that deserves some more support.

To sum things up, If Guilty Gear Xrd Revelator was a beverage, it would most likely be Universe Juice. Thank you for reading this review.

28784422.review:
Great fighting game with an excellent netcode (3-4f delay "Germany - Russia", 1f delay "Germany-Netherlands"), an awesome soundtrack and a great visual presentation. 

Every character (23 in total) feels really unique to play with and the game offers a great variety of missions, challenges and a tutorial to get used to the game. The online lobby system of XRD puts the main fighting game contender on PC (Street Fighter 5) to shame, because it offers an incredible amount of options to customize your lobby for your netplay sessions.

Definitely recommended for everyone who wants to try out a new fighting game and who is sick of SFV.

Sign은 한국어 장착으로 시작이었는데 본작은 추가 패치를 기다려야 한다는 점.

Sign과 비교했을 때 뭐랄까, 특전 제공하던 extra 음원이 적다는 점.

디지털 피규어 모드나 캐릭터 색, 엠블렘, 온라인 캐릭터 머리 등을 낚시로 랜덤하게 나오게 하는 건 이해할 수 있지만, 엠블렘은 돈주고 살 수 있으면서 캐릭터 색, 온라인 캐릭터 꾸미기, 디지털 피규어 모드는 돈 주고 살 수 없다는 점.

낚시에서 진짜 물고기가 낚인다는 점(...) 이 물고기는 대체 뭐에 쓰는건지 모르겠고.

28738704.review: Fast paced fighter with deep mechanics that will keep dedicated fighting game fans busy and newbies interested. For people who aren't skilled in fighting games, there is a beginner mode called "stylish" that lets button mashers stand a chance against skilled players.  Expands upon the progress that -SIGN- started with several new mechanics (Burst supers, blitz shield, wall-pin dust attacks,) the return of M.O.M mode, new story, 3 returning characters (Dizzy, Johnny, and Jam) and 3 new characters (Raven, Jack-O, and Kum). The king of anime-inspired fighting games returns!

28731680.review:
Ох блин. Это тяжло информативно и кратко описать всё что я думаю о Гилтах.
Я фанат жанра и серии... и играл в Гилты с Guilty Gear Х, тогда, когда никто не знал, что "те спайты мы будем видеть Жманцать лет" и можно было задрочить ФД-КЕНСЕЛ и донимать людей.
Я вырос с этой серией и она сформировала для меня представление комфорта в жанре. 

Гилты обладают одной из наиприятнейших игровых систем в жанре.
1. Игра даёт вам широчайший выбор игровых механик, которые позволят вам иметь выход из 99% ситуаций.
2. При этом игра позволяет вам учиться им в свободном порядке, потому что зачастую многие ситуации решаются разными способами. 
3. Гилты приятно смотреть, если вас не рвёт от аниму. С одной стороны темп Гилтов очень гармоничен, с другой игра подчёркивает нужную информацию для игроков и зрителей.
4. Гилты обладают очень разнообразным набором персонажей. Каждый персонаж обладает своей "тематикой", которая реализованна по своему.
5. Эта игра в серии обладает хорошим набором свистелок, от бонус режима М.о.М. (где можно растить своего ""покемона"" и потом играть по сети) до хорошо продуманного обучения, истории, галереи, аркадного режима и т.п. и т.д.
6. Не смтря на то, что игру купио пока мало народу, найти игроков по сети в ней можно быстрее чем в СФ5 (это личный опыт и не распространяется на жителей Сахалина, Океании и других мест без интернета, людей, любви, гравитации и в̡̢с̸̨͟е̴̢п̷о̴̶̴ж͘ир̢̕͜аю̧͞ще̷́г͏͡о̢ у̡̡̓̾̕ж̵̢͊̊̆̍̾͐ͧ̑а̛̄͆̑̕͜с̒ͪ̿ͧ̄ͧ͟аͧͦͥ̈́̽̍, к͕͓̹̩͉̗͢ͅо͍͟т̯͢ор̞̙̜̻ы͏й̶̗͙̼̼ ͖̳̯̜̗͜н͘а͙̩̜ͅч͚̣̯̺ͅͅи̹͔̺̯н̩͓͎͓̜͎͜а͙̳̮́е̛͉̦т̼̻̮ м͕̮͎͈̟̖̰̦е̟̘̟͈̰д̙͈̗͓͇̫͙͝л̷̤̭̼̲̳е̶̫̱͈̪̞̪͞ͅн̨̪̺̣̀͝н҉̘̬̼̺͢о҉̷͖̪̗̗ ̷̲п̰̟͓̲̖͘и͍͜͝т̻͍ь̵̼ ̴͉͝т̵̳͎̝̗̙̼̯͕͘в̙͙̲͕͞о͜͏̶̩̦̮͔̲̪̙͕ё̢͖͔̰͓̀ ̥͇̙̲̣̟̼̖͙͟с͈̺̟̳͝͝о̹͓̼̕з̸͕̲́͢н̝͓а̨̺͉̱̜̤̝̕н̷̯͇̞̳̰͎̳͎͘͜и̴̣͞е͚̖̲͖ П͉͍̲̌ͫ̉Р̺̱̐̎̎͑ͤ̃ͮ̅И̙̮͉̠̮͖ͬ͆̉С̱̤̮̽̄Л̰̘͎̫̘͔͔̻͙̾ͮͮ̔У̦̟̯̝̣̍͋̽̍Ш̯̬̰͐͒̔ͨ͒ͤ̃̌А̤̩͉̳ͥ͐͌ͨͭͪ̈́́̆Й̬̦̆̍ͣС̖͉͒͊ͫͤЯ̻̤͈̠̭ͨͮ̑. о̷͎̹͎̤̟̝̹͖̯͕̹̕͡н̴̵̕҉̺̜͕̲͔ͅ ̴̢͖͎̰̥̮̪̪у̷̷̠̜̲̦̪̟̩͉̘͞ж̨̳͖͈̣̹̮̖̦̹̠͖̭̤͈̣͜͡͞е̷̦͉͍͉́͘͟͟ т̧у̵͟͠т́͘)

--------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------

28714818.review:
I had a hard time justifying the price of this but now that I have it I'm really happy I bought it. Compared to Capcom, you at least get a full game here for the price and it can last for hours and hours trying to get better at it. I've been playing this series on and off since Guilty Gear X and it has come one hell of a long way since then. Something that's really surprised me with Xrd has been the massive improvement to the story mode and story telling, something that was never particularly given away or told clearly in previous Gear games.

Assuming you like anime style stories, awesome fighting gameplay and can find enjoyment in the other game modes, I'd say you could easily get your money worth here.

I'll recommend it only if you're a die hard fan or don't have -sign-. It's hard to say not to buy it though. The game feels, looks, and plays like it's worth 60$ but the fact that it took this long for it to be released and that the older version is available for half the price while only lacking nonessential quality additions , 2-3 gimmicks, and 6 characters makes it also a good choice to grab instead. Don't get me wrong though I personally have played around 24h's of the game and already feel like it was money well spent. Man I'm contradictive.

TL;DR Get this unless you don't like the new 6 characters or won't miss a few graphical upgrades, then just buy -Sign- for half the price.

28696758.review:
DCのGUILTY GEAR Xからのファンで、初めてこれを手にした時には驚愕したのを覚えています。
当時でも2D格闘ゲームとして他より一歩抜きん出ていた(グラフィック・ゲーム・音楽)
各シリースを経てそのすべてにおけるセンスの良さを失う事無く進化を遂げている。
SIGNをやった時もえっえっ？何で2Dが立体に見えてるの？ と驚愕した・・・3Dだった。
3D化しても正当2D格闘の良い味付けを保守しつつ、迫力ある3D演出がさらにそれを引き立てる。
そして音楽、毎回カッコ良すぎ。 格闘が始まる直前からテンション(闘争心)MAX

ゲーム性も相変わらず 素晴らしく本当に遊んでいて楽しい格闘ゲーム。

色んなアトラクションでボリュームも充実、価格もこれなら安いと思う。
ケチのつけるところを探すのが困難な程 素晴らしい格闘ゲーム。
しいて一つ加えるのなら今時の格ゲーの風潮とも言えるキャラのDLC販売
これは時代に逆行して欲しいな 昔は苦労してキャラをが使える様になった時は嬉かった
ディズィーもそう,苦労して使える様になった時の嬉しさ・・・が今はDLC、これが何か寂しさを感じた。

無駄に長文になりましたが、GUILTY GEAR Xrd -REVELATOR-を一言で表すなら『センス』
センスの固まりのような格闘ゲームだと思う。

28650685.review:
You may think this game could simply be an expensive DLC for Guilty Gear Xrd -SIGN- and you'd be wrong.
Guilty Gear Xrd -REVELATOR- brings up new characters, new game mechanics, global lighting, a new lobby system, a new story arc and a lot more goodies (extended gallery, diorama figures, fishing...).

Dizzy, Johnny, Jam get back to Guilty Gear along with [strike]Crow[/strike] Raven from Guilty Gear 2: Overture and 2 brand-new characters, no need to say that the amount of detail fits Xrd standards (anime like shadows and moves, now even with global lighting)
New mechanics are definitely not [b]that[/b] new/exiting but they still add something to the gameplay, the new lobby system on the other hand is amazing: you get your customizable avatar moving around inside a room with actual cabinets (max 4 + 1 for training mode) and you challenge people in line on the room, amazing.
Story mode feels actually a lot better than Xrd -SIGN- one because the team focused more on "anime", with better photography and camera angles and the addition of global lighting.
Finally goodies section is so huge... a few honorable mentions are: voice actor bonus speech, diorama action figures, usable (during fights) music tracks from all over Guilty Gear history.

Of course [b]everything[/b] from the paragraph above on top of Guilty Gear Xrd -SIGN-, probably with a better netplay (lv.3 connections grant you a very good match, lv.4 connections allow totally safe reaction play throughout the game, very enjoyable).
Right now I cannot recommend any fighting game for PC better than this one and personally I think this is one of the greatest ones I ever played.

Strongly recommended for everyone, a must have for anime and/or fighting games enthusiasts.

Buy this

Well, you can wait for a discount of course, like many are doing. But it is a really good game. I am not regretting the purchase, though the high price made me not buy a second copy. Still, it has by far the best fighting game graphics (if you care), a truly great tutorial, awesome gameplay which mean it is definitely worth buying, but whether or not it is worth buying right now, at this price? That question is one each person must answer individually. I've decided that yes, it is, and so I've played it.

At least Revelator won't be outdated for at least a year (blame the dev, not me, if it's untrue), so that seems very promising. Since the Engrish trailer mentions "exciting updates" and "more battle actions ahead (???)" right after listing the entire roster, I bet more characters are on the way, though you never know for sure. Arcsys devs make some of the goddamn best products on the market by far, but the way they advertise and market stuff Is definitely not too good.

28486357.review:
Without question the best-made fighting game out there.

~ The Good ~
The multiplayer lobby system has virtual arcade machines for a room of players to mingle, fight, and watch.  With Revelator, the lobby now includes a customizable cute avatar and a virtual environment.  Multiplayer uses the basic Steam friends features and the netplay is lag-free in my experience.

The meat of GG Xrd is a cast of diverse, well-balanced characters who ooze personality.  While rushdown and setplay are major themes of the game, every character archetype you'd expect from a complete fighter is represented: grapplers, projectile zoners, "Dhalsim" stretchy zoning, rekkas.  There's even a character that fills the screen with minions.

Easy to learn, hard to master mechanics provide a lot of room for creativity, but don't require grinding out perfection in practice mode as much as many games... but if that's your thing, you can construct optimal combos and set-ups in the training room for hours.  The "Gatling" (chain combo) system makes the game approachable for new players who are often put off by awkward link comboing.  There's even a "stylish" mode where inputs are simplified so you can play with your scrub friends.

Despite being fairly technical, Xrd is a spectacular intro for fighting game and Guilty Gear outsiders.  Newbies can start with a tutorial teaching basic controls, play through missions designed to teach concepts and basic skills, and end with character specific combo challenges that you'll actually use.  There's also a full arcade and story mode, although the story mode is more of a visual novel.

The visuals are gorgeous, but also convey information clearly.  For such a hectic game, you'll never feel that a move's animation failed to convey its heft or reach. The sound track is a high-energy mashup of heavy metal influences.

Great performance, quick load times. Plug and play controller support for every controller I've tried.


The Bad
- No English dubs in -Revelator-.  -Sign- had them.
- It would be nice to see cross platform play with consoles, even though that feature is very rare.
- Paying full price for -Sign- plus new characters and a couple of new mechanics... on a six month delay.

The Awkward
- It's a little bit weeaboo (but not as bad as other ArcSys games).
- We're hoping -Revelator-'s release on PC isn't immediately followed by a new version announcement for arcade/consoles.  (But none has shown up in arcades yet.)
- Unlocking character colors you were accustomed to using in -Sign-.  But this might also be something that keeps players coming back.


Even if GG isn't your thing, the quality of Xrd is indisputable.
Finally: here's a neat video about how they achieved the art style: https://www.youtube.com/watch?v=yhGjCzxJV3E

28486353.review:
"HEAVEN OR HELL, LET'S ROCK!"
Since the beginning of the series back on the original Playstation, the announcer in Guilty Gear has been calling out that same line at the beginning of every fight, and it never gets old. The rich heavy metal stylings of Guilty Gear have evolved constantly since the series inception, from the hard hitting sequel Guilty Gear X on the Dreamcast, the much celebrated Guilty Gear XX: The Midnight Carnival on the Playstation 2 (I'd like to pretend that Guilty Gear Isuka never happened), all the way up to Guilty Gear XX Accent Core on modern systems. And now everything has culminated in the release of the latest chapter, Guilty Gear Xrd -Revelator-.

If you've played any game in the Guilty Gear series you know what you're in for with -Revelator-, from the massive combos that the series is know for to the signature all or nothing instant-kill moves that can end a match instantly if you pull them off, but if you miss, you're toast. The controls are tight, the animations smooth, and the Unreal engine provides a perfect canvas for the series creator Daisuke Ishiwatari to strut his stuff. Instead of hand-drawn animated sprites that the earlier games used, the characters are all 3d models now, and are animated in such a way that they still appear to be hand animated, which is important as timing most moves and combos require you to watch for certain frames in the animation cycle. It's the perfect blend of modern technology and oldschool aesthetic.

So you have the usual Guilty Gear awesomeness in this package, plus a massive sit-back-and-watch cinematic story mode that will take hours to go through, nearly flawless lag-free online fighting, the requisite Master of Medals mode, and then on top of all that, it's got minigames out the wazoo. You also get a figure mode that lets you collect posable action figures of the main cast, and a bigass gallery of art, music and videos. Everything in the gallery has to be unlocked wither through fight money (world dollars) or fishing them up in the minigame mode. The entire game soundtrack is in there, plus alternate songs from other games in the series. All in all, it's pretty robust.

When it comes down to it, Guilty Gear Xrd -Revelator- is a shining example of how to bring a fighting game to the PC. There's plenty of graphical options, and the engine is superbly optimized (I can get over 200fps on my GTX 970, and my Alienware Steam machine r1 plays the game at 90+ maxed out). The only thing that let me down is the superb english dub that was present in the previous game, Xrd -Sign-, is missing here due to time constraints. Even so, -Revelator- is pretty much the perfect package, and there's enough content here to keep fighting fans entertained for a long time. I completely and wholeheartedly recommend it.

28481970.review:
Guilty Gear Xrd - Revelator - is probably the best fighting game to date.
It has the best tutorial in all of fighting games, allowing a simple newcomer to the genre to understand every aspect of the genre and Revelator.
It has next to no input lag, allowing for the smoothest experience you can possibly imagine.
The netcode is rock solid, with only 2-4frames of lag on good connections, without any noticeable lag spikes or latency issues.
The visual and aesthetic design of Revelator is AMAZING. The soundtrack is absolutely astonishing with upbeat electric guitar and drums pumping adrenaline through every match, and the graphical style of Revelator is simple a sight to behold. If you're not that into fighting games, you owe it to yourself to at least buy Revelator, run it the best you can and just stare at the amazing visuals. 
The PC port is great, and wont let you down with lack of Dinput support, Xinput support, Rebindable keys for both keyboard and controller and barely any issues with running.
I have experienced 2 crashes, one on startup the very first time i booted it up, however this has only happened once, despite trying to replicate it.
I also experienced a crash after trying to exit it via Alt+F4, but that was most likely right at the start of an auto save, as the save data was wiped.
The game also has a slightly sketchy business model, with 3 characters as DLC on day 1, despite very clearly being in the game. One of those can be earned with ingame currency, but the 2 others are locked behind a paywall.

Despite these faults, the game is still great. Definetly pick this up.

28478235.review:
GUILTY GEAR Xrd -REVELATOR- is the follow up game from GUILTY GEAR Xrd -SIGN-, and just like SIGN, it's an amazing port. REVELATOR improves upon SIGN in all aspects, and gives the game the extra bit of polishing it needed. 

My one complaint about the game however is the lack of monitor resolutions to choose from. With only the options of 1280 x 720, 1366 x 768 and 1920 x 1080, it makes users such as myself with 1680 x 1050 monitors have to tweak some .ini settings, which is not THAT much of a hassle, however it would be nice to have the option in-game. 

Everything else about the game is near flawless. Story mode is great, figures are a blast to play around with, and the brand new lobbies makes the multiplayer experience even better than it already was.

I highly recommend REVELATOR, it's one of the best fighting games out in the market, and if you like fighting games, you'll LOVE Guilty Gear.

28473503.review:
I honestly couldn't believe I hadn't played a Guilty Gear before this one.

Guilty Gear Xrd - REVELATOR- has absolutely stunning visuals and incredible gameplay. The story, although unwelcoming to newcomers like myself, is interesting enough to it make me want to play the previous entries that I'd missed, which is rare in a fighting game.  The gameplay is fast paced with many unique mechanics to help balance the diverse character play styles.

If you are new to fighting games, GGxrdR also comes with a fun (actually fun) tutorial, covering all of the basics, along with an incredible number of combo tutorials for every character as well as missions to teach you more about the game and how to overcome specific character match-ups.  I really wish more fighting games were as in-depth as this. 

The only big con is that because the game is so niche, and the playerbase is split between the PS4 and now PC, the online can be a little unreliable to find matches.  You will probably have to do some networking on appropriate forums or find friends to play with if you want consistant matches around your skill level.  Even if you never play online, there are tons to do with the large amount of combo tutorials and missions to complete.

If you're looking for a modern day fighting game, or just an incredibly solid, complex, traditional fighter, look no further than Guilty Gear Xrd -REVELATOR-, because it will completely fill that void.

What if you've never played a Guilty Gear before like me?  Well let's just say that this made me a fan.

Just be prepared to put in the time if you want to be any decent.  I myself have a lot of catching up to do.  ;)

28466815.review:
Guilty Gear Xrd -SIGN- byla podle mě jedna z nejlepších bojovek a -REVELATOR- je imo ještě lepší. Za mě se jedná o "must have" titul pro každého "bojovkáře", ať už máte rádi Guilty Gear, nebo je to pro vás velká neznámá.

Plusy:
- STORY - stejně jako v mnoha hrách od Arc System Works, story mode neobsahuje žádný combat, ale můžete se těšit na plnohodnotný anime film. Příběh je temný, má to "drive", skvělé zpracování a epický konec :)
- CHARACTERS - 23 unikátních postav se někomu může zdát málo, ale vzhledem k odlišnosti postav a jejich stylů nemám co vytknout
- COMBAT - imo ještě lepší a lépe vybalancovaný než v -SIGN-, badass comba, hromada pohybů, efektů a special moves
- GRAFIKA - skvělá stylizace (samozřejmě pokud má někdo averzi k anime a cartoon graphics, tak ruce pryč), stejně jako v -SIGN- se jedná o klasickou 2D fighter hru ve 3D prostředí
- SOUNDTRACK - nářez, kytary jsou prostě moje a některý tracky jsou neskutečně našlápnutý :)
- TUTORIAL - tutorial je udělaný perfektně a je neskutečně efektivní, z toho by si mohla vzít spousta fighting games příklad :)

Minusy:
- hra je na první pohled až moc podobná svému předchůdci, takže hodně lidí nevidí důvod jí kupovat
- cena - stejně jako část komunity, zastávám názor, že nižší cena by pomohla navýšit "player base" a GG série by se stala známější, na druhou stranu za svoje peníze dostanete na dnešní poměry kvalitní port bez bugů, crashů a klasických after-launch problémů + film ve story mode.

Ostatní:
- ONLINE - nečekejte hromadu "rooms" a tisíce hráčů online, komunita GG je celkem malá, na druhou stranu je Revelator jednou z mála fighting games na PC, kde v ranked žebříčku nenajdete hackery (na prvních pozicích jsou hráči s cca 70% wins) a doufám že to tak zůstane :)
- DLC - deluxe verze hry se vzhledem k ceně jednotlivých DLC samozřejmě vyplatí, ale obsah jednotlivých DLC je diskutabilní, bonusové barvy jsou imo nic moc (jestli u postavy marně hledáte černo-modrou kombinaci, není třeba mít DLC, stačí dohrát režim arcade episode na jakoukoli obtížnost), system voice pack určitě není "must have", stejně jako kostým pro Elphelt.
- DABING - JPN only - dabing v japonštině je perfektní, absence ENG dabingu mi vůbec nevadí, ale chápu že pro někoho to může být mínusem

28460503.review:
一代名作，白菜价，自带中文。和前作比较，加入6名新角色和蓄力攻击、超杀D强化的新系统。MOM模式的机制有很细心的调整，不用走格子了。挑战完成的判定等快，减少了等待时间。迷你游戏也很有趣。好话不说了，总之强烈推荐。

已经确定要以DLC的形式出加强版本并追加角色。


——————————-鸡蛋里挑骨头的分割线———————————————


令人不爽的地方：
1.键盘不能像前作一样设置2P，甚至1个手柄也不能单机双人对战，必须双手柄或摇杆。
2.全屏分辨率不可调，窗口没有1024级别的选项。
3.不能关阴影，官方提供的“优先处理”选项效果微乎其微。对低配置不太友好。
   
老爷机手动修改 REDGame\Config\REDSystemSettings.ini这个文件，关闭关闭下面四个选项（设置成FALSE）可有20帧的提升。

DynamicShadows=False
LightEnvironmentShadows=False
CompositeDynamicLights=False
………………
FloatingPointRenderTargets=False

虽然损失了阴影，但是可以全屏60帧。而之前640分辨率也不能满帧，区别还是相当大的。

希望能在设置里添加相应选项。


4.升级补丁希望小点，不要像前作一样直接把动画以外的文件全部扔上来，动不动就3G还当天回滚啥的。

5.还我TE。

28458239.review: A cada versão que é lançada da franquia GUILTY GEAR o jogo só melhora. O jogo tem novas estórias interessantes, são acrescentados novos personagens, alguns personagens são alterados, eles tem poderes fantásticos e impressionantes, só faltou uma personagem que eu jogo, eu jogo com quatro personagens. 28443719.review:
ギルティギアシリーズ最新作GGxrdRがついにSteamへ
ストーリーは一番初めに前作SIGNの総集編付きです
ゲーム内通貨が貯まればデジタルフィギュアモードだけでも数時間つぶせます

↓ここからはノートPC勢向け↓

GeForceなどがなくintel HD GraphicsなどのCPU内蔵GPUで動かすには少し重い感じでMAX設定ではステージによってfps低下が激しい感じ
オプション内に「画質優先」と「処理速度優先」の2項目があり、後者にすればおおむね改善されますがジャギーがなかなかにひどいです
そこで「画質優先」のまま「ポストエフェクト」OFFでジャギー化を抑えつつfpsを上げることができます
このゲームのグラフィック設定は解像度とフルスクリーンON/OFFの設定が分かれていない(1920x1080の上がフルスクリーン)ので、解像度を落としてフルスクにしたい場合は解像度の設定を変更後にオプションメニューから離脱後F11を押して強制的にフルスクにできます これを使えばさらにfpsの保持ができます

ここまでに述べた設定＋1280*720+垂直同期OFFを適用して以下の環境で対戦中だいたい60fpsを確保できました
intel Core i7-6500U 2.50GHz
intel HD Graphics 520
RAM 8GB

28441059.review:
- 장점
+ 개성있는 캐릭터들
+ 엄청나게 많은 싱글 컨텐츠 
+ 재미있는 튜토리얼 (격겜에서 볼 수 있는 최고의 튜토리얼!!)
+ 쉬운 진입장벽 (마스터는 어려움)
+ 최고의 연출

- 단점
- 적은 멀티 유저들 / 고수들
- DLC들 (디럭스 에디션 구매 강력 추천)

- 종합 평가 -

예전 PSP로 철권을 했던 것을 빼면, 격투 게임을 진지하게 즐겨본건 이 게임이 처음입니다.
격투 게임의 고질적인 문제인 진입장벽에 대해서 많이 걱정했는데 다행스럽게도 제가 했던 격투게임 중에서
가장 뛰어나고 심지어 재미있기까지 한 튜토리얼이 있었습니다. 심지어 호불호가 갈리는 시스템이긴 하지만 초보자를 위한
'원 버튼 콤보 (스타일리쉬)' 시스템도 있습니다. 이런 제작진의 노력덕분에, 진입장벽은 다른 평범한 게임들하고 비슷하다고 필자는 보고 있습니다.

연출, 연출을 빼놓을 수가 없죠. 이 게임의 연출은 다른 게임이 감히 넘볼 수가 없는 수준입니다. 하나의 애니메이션을 보고 있는 기분이라니까요. 캐릭터들은 다른 격투게임에 비하면 적지만, 모두 뚜렷한 개성이 있습니다! 한 번 보면 당분간은 잊혀지지 않을, 그런 개성말입니다.
무엇보다 놀란건, 싱글컨텐츠가 정말 무지막지하게 많다는 점입니다. 아케이드도 없다던 옆동네 게임, '길거리 깡패들5'를 보고 살짝 걱정을 했습니다만, 전혀 걱정할 필요가 없었습니다. 
멀티는 사람은 적지만, 신경쓰일 정도는 아닙니다. 충분히 게임을 즐길 수 있으니까요. 랭크 매치는 예외이긴 합니다..

격투 게임을 좋아하신다면, 이 작품을 놓치지 마세요.

28440694.review:
[url=http://code-examples-ja.hateblo.jp/entry/2014/07/19/Windows7_.bat%E3%83%95%E3%82%A1%E3%82%A4%E3%83%AB%E3%81%AE%E9%96%A2%E9%80%A3%E4%BB%98%E3%81%91%E3%82%92%E5%85%83%E3%81%AB%E6%88%BB%E3%81%99]batファイルの関連付け変更してて起動できない人向けリンク[/url]

起動できなくてイライラしている人は（自分だけ？）ささっと修正して、ゲームを楽しんで下さい。

28440302.review:
Делаю этот обзор скорее для тех, кто сомневается в покупке этой игры, особенно если играли в XRD: Sign.

Я сам думал что игра не стоит своих денег, если Sign мы взяли за 400-500 рублей, а если взять сразу в первые дни выпуска игры то у нас сразу "Deluxe" версия была. То тут цены намного строже, да и Deluxe отдельно брать....В общем решил всё таки купить и попробовать.
Я не пожалел!

Игра шикарная, новые персонажи сами по себе выглядят прикольно, так ещё и боевой стиль у них интересный. Классные приёмы, а новая музыка что для них, что для старых персонажей не может не порадовать)

Я напишу краткий список плюсов и минусов этой игры
Плюсы:
1) Рыбалка. За деньги накопленные после сражений вы можете рыбачить, и выловить всякие интересные штуки для вашего мультиплеерного персонажа. Возможно, можно выловить что то ещё чего я не знаю)
2) Переработан мультиплеер. Теперь при создании комнаты или поиска комнат, вы попадёте в реальную комнатку, у вас будет персонаж, маленький человечек которого можно внешне изменять. Бегаете по комнате с другими игроками, можете попинать мячик, пообщаться в чате, подружиться и спамить эмоциями. Можете подойти к игровым автоматам и стать наблюдателем какого либо матча, либо же сами поучаствовать. ЛАГОВ стало крайне мало. Если раньше (возможно из за слабого компа) в мультиплеере часто сильно всё висло. То сейчас работает чуть ли не идеально. Могу спокойно играть даже с теми у кого очень высокий пинг.
3) Галлерея. Чтобы было куда деньги тратить, теперь в галлерее сделали столик с вашими фигурками. После рыбалки вам может выпасть фигурка с определённой позой на любого из героев, преображайте его,  покажите какими крутыми или забавными вы можете сделать своих любимых героев. Добавили музыку из других частей, например Isuka, цвета на персонажей теперь также надо покупать на заработанные очки. 
4) Режим тренировок и обучения. Сам режим обучения как по мне получился сложнее, заставляет игроков двигаться и запоминать что они делают, учат таким основам боя как Roman Cancel. А раздел тренировок комбо у персонажей стал немногим удобнее в плане интерфейса.
5) Новый режим поединков. Теперь есть Технический (стандартный стиль боя который был во всех частях), и Стильный. Стильный упрощает боевую систему, компьютер сам в определённое время начнет выбирать за вас какие пнопки нужно нажать чтобы получилось сильное комбо. Это очень полезно для новичков, да и в целом игра эффектнее выглядит так. Но всё же куда круче когда ты сам умеешь делать эти приёмы. Сразу вспоминаю как когда то давным давно в XX Reload мы с другом выучив все приёмы на наших любимых персонажах, старались драться подражая тем поединкам которые были во время прохождения сюжетки. Каеф!
Минусы:
1) Цена. Не каждый готов заплатить такую сумму за незнакомую ему игру. Потому ряды новичков порядеют.
2) Временно низкий онлайн. Игроков пока немного, игра только вышла. Кто то сомневается, а кто то может и не знает о ней. Найти соперника вы всё равно сможете, не переживайте)

Итог: в игру ввели много всяких плюшек, она стала интереснее и в ней теперь реально есть чем заняться помимо тренировок комбух и файтинга. Новые персонажи (как и старые забытые) сбалансированы и интересны, музыка просто огонь + её стало ещё больше. Я советую вам её взять, не пожалеете)

Если хотите, то добавляйтесь в друзья, будем вместе учиться, тренироваться, и просто фаниться в мультиплеере.
Спасибо всем кто прочитал обзор, я очень надеюсь что он помог вам решиться с покупкой игры. Сайонара!

28435209.review:
Let's be honest... This is a good fighting game. Crazy character design, beautiful graphics, tutorials and missions that really teach you the basics of the game and of every character, some funny PvE modes... there might be a few too many mechanics (even if it feels more streamlined compared to Sign) but it's okay, they give you the tools to have fun.

But let's be even more honest... well, the following part originally contained complaints about the pricetag, but since they ended up lowering it to something that makes sense they can be considered as null and void. If only it didn't take them 6 months and a new upgrade for that... but who cares. At least this time we'll get the new version pretty much at the same time as console, so I can only thank them for showing some care for PC.

I can finally recommend the game as it is. Get Revelator and have fun.

I'll keep the original review instead of making a new one to let you savour the salty comments from ArcSys fanboys that kept commenting here for half a year.

28419517.review:
결론을 미리 말하자면 이 게임은 갓겜이 맞습니다. 연동은 안되지만
게임이 어렵다고 하시는 분들 좀 있는데 어려운건 사실입니다. 시스템이라던가 게임 자체가 공격 9 방어 1 비율로 공격이 압도적으로 유리하니까요. 구석에 몰리면서 상하단 이지선다 무한 반복이라던가 그런게 있기도 하고
니가와 플레이로 백스텝 자주하면 패널티도 있어서 왠만하면 공격이 유리하죠
시스템이 어렵지 게임 자체가 어려운편은 아니니 안심해도 됩니다.콤보도 어려운 거 몇몇 빼면 할만한 편이기도하고 스타일리쉬모드로 콤보 편의성도 있으니까
캐릭터 성능에 관해서는 강캐든 약캐든 신경쓰지마여 9:1 불리급은 왠만해선 없으니까 유입하실때 캐릭터는 끌리는걸 하시면 됩니다. 물론 거기에 따른 연습도 해야죠 이건 격투게임 자체의 문제라 어쩔 수 없는 부분입니다.

요약하자면
1. 처음 할 때 캐릭은 끌리는걸 해도 상관없음 애정캐로 해도 어짜피 하드하게 할거 아니면 상성빨 타도 이기는 경우도 있음
2.사고 초반에는 대전하면 털리는건 각오해야함 연습도 필요하고 얻어맞으면서 실력이 느는 경우도 아예 없지는 않음.

28419171.review:
I'll just add to what I think still haven't been elaborated.

------------------------------------------

Vastly improved netcode.
- Connection is actually consistent now. frame delay sticks to a certain value and I've yet to see spikes of any amount.


Better optimization.
- I could crank up the graphic settings to maximum now & it'd have no performance impact whatsoever. 

Also worth noting that playing on any stage online is now actually viable & a thing. Unlike back then in steam SIGN, where for the most part you can only play at the Japan & Central Organ Tower map to avoid connection desync between players.


Battle damage
- Scratches now appear on character models after they take damage. It's very minor, but a nice addition nonetheless.


Online Match Room & Fishing Spot
- I heard there aren't lobbies where you can roam around as on consoles yet, however some of these are in & that's already pretty nice. Inside rooms you can still play football & otherwise, fish for stuffs at the fishing spot.

Inside rooms, you are free to linger around & play all of the other offline game modes even. This is great for when you're waiting for players and stuff inside the room.

Since fishing costs in-game money, and they unlock things that aren't unlockable otherwise (e.g. diorama mode items), you could practically grind for in-game money so you can keep unlocking things. Making in-game money more of a thing now & gives you incentives to just keep playing the game, fighting or whatever.  


Story & Episode Mode
- SIGN's story took a slow start at the beginning, since it's very well a new story arc in the universe after XX and they were making sure you weren't lost on the big picture. Since that has been covered though, REVELATOR's story is more on point & more engaging from the get go.

For those who haven't seen SIGN's story, at the beginning of REVELATOR's, you are also shown the entire story of SIGN in a short recap.

Two gripes about it however, is that the subtitles are kinda too fast. Another thing being, there's still no seek bars for the story, even though you can pause & save at any moment. The story would continue at the exact moment you saved when you load them again.


------------------------------------------

All in all, it's definitely worth the upgrade from SIGN. The price may be steep, but I understand that these things need money for the R&D (which imo has been spent well on). The game is in a great state now even though it's just been released for PC. Have yet to encounter bugs or things needing fixes. It's great to play both offline & online.

Besides, we all had SIGN for goddamned cheap. Think of it as paying what you saved on SIGN for REVELATOR and it breaks even.

28416669.review:
翘首以盼的罪恶装备系列新作REVELATOR终于登陆STEAM了！！！
在看了几个月日本的各种对战视频后我们终于能够在PC平台上玩到最新版本了，可喜可贺，可喜可贺！

本作在游戏引擎上沿用了上一作SIGN的游戏引擎，进一步优化了画面以及对配置的要求，同时秉承了上一作的各种优良传统：爽快的对决，华丽的连招以及流畅的网战。可以说一款格斗游戏应当具备的品质他都有了。

游戏性方面在继承了前作SIGN的基本玩法的基础上新加入了如 横向DUST、解投、蓄力闪电盾等新系统，让本来就变幻莫测的战局更加刺激紧张。

角色方面，新增了3个新角色以及从上一世代GG系列回归了的3个旧角色，总计23个可选角色每一个都拥有独特的玩法，就算按照平均每一个角色需要2小时时间熟悉来算，对新玩家来说全角色熟悉至少都要46个小时。更何况正常情况下一个角色至少要花费五六十小时的功夫训练，否则根本根本拿不出手去和别人打。那些上一作SIGN的大佬们游戏时间基本都是500+小时起步，可见罪恶装备系列耐玩性之高。

同时，本作还引入了BB系列的“帅气模式”作为可选模式，在角色选择画面选中角色后按下，就可以开启。和BB系列一样，简易出招，一键COMBO点击就送，手残党们的福音。




但是

上面这些都不是重点！

你以为这仅仅是一款格斗游戏？

不，其实这是一部剧情给力的动画片，同时这还是一款养成收集游戏！比起上一作只有故事模式，本作新加入了“钓鱼”和“手办”模式。

钓鱼：通过使用游戏内的金钱钓鱼可以获得画廊内各种CV语音、插图、音乐、配色以及手办模式中使用的各种配件，比起直接使用游戏币购买，钓鱼要划算很多。

手办：在手办模式中，你可以随心摆弄通过钓鱼获得的游戏内的角色模型以及台座，摆各式各样羞耻的POSE，选择喜欢的角度拍照[spoiler]比如JAM的胖次、INO的后颈[/spoiler]。这模式对于我这种疲倦于与人争斗每天就喜欢弄弄手办，玩玩模拟情景剧

的人来说，简直爽过吸大麻！

综上所述：
- 这是一部长达10+小时的良心动画
- 这是一款老少皆宜、内容丰富的养成收集类游戏
[spoiler]- 同时还附送一款格斗游戏 LOL [/spoiler]

10/10

那么，骚年你还在等什么，赶快掏出你的钱包！
