28416234.review:
The most recent Guilty Gear finally arrives on PC! If you, like me, are bummed at the mess that Street Fighter V was/is, have I got a game for you...

Pros:
Characters - 23 characters, all unique and entertaining, with more possibly on the way
Single-player content - With "Episodes" for each character and a cinematic story mode for those interested in the deep lore, and a Tutorial, Missions, Combos for every character, and a robust Training mode for the lab monsters, as well as MOM for an interesting take on things.
Competitive - Arc System Works has consistently had good netcode, and communities to play with are easy enough to find.
Visuals - Stunning. Probably the best-looking fighting game in terms of aesthetics.
Music - Daisuke Ishiwatari strikes again with new songs like "Juno" and "One Dawn", while it also includes the same old songs SIGN had and adds classics like "Awe of She" and "Irony of Chaste" from previous games.
Gameplay - Fantastic as usual, and the addition of Throw Breaks and making Danger Time slightly less random have been positive changes.

Cons:
Controller support - I'm using a DS4, and even though Steam supports it, REVELATOR does some...odd things. Slightly fixable through the config menu, but still visually confusing.
Pricing - Kinda expensive, especially for the deluxe version. Also, two of the characters are Paid DLC, which kinda grates.

All in all, a fantastic game. If you don't want to buy it just yet, wait for a sale and you won't regret it.

28402211.review:
Guilty Gear is perhaps my all time favorite fighting game series. I was a bit worried about REVELATOR before the purchase. The English dub was a treat to see in SIGN for me, and it sucked to hear it was going to be out. I wouldn't have minded as much if it wasn't put into the series, and then taken out. I was excited at the prospect of hearing a few of these characters in English, some of which we got a taste of in the previous story mode. I can only hope one day the devs re-consider. Even as DLC I'd love to have it again. Not a big deal for most potential buyers, I know, it's the gameplay that matters, but for me it was personally a nice touch. Also, the price for the Steam version, even with a discount for owning SIGN was still way higher than I expected. By now I'm sure it's easy to find inexpensive on PS4, however, I don't own one of those. Despite these issues, I felt it'd be good to show support.

I've only dipped my feet in and did the episode for Johnny, but I can tell that it's what I generally wanted. It's Xrd, only bigger and better. The tutorials are improved, and it feels like this will be much easier to immerse myself in and try to fight it out online after some practice. Also, one wonderful surprise is the unlockable music. WAY more classics from previous Guilty Gear games than I expected, even Fatal Duel from GGX which I hoped so hard to see in Xrd.

If you're hesistant on the price, and have played any form of Xrd, if you're not a big fan, you may want to wait for a sale, but for me I know I'm going to get my moneys worth here.

28400538.review:
Warning: This game is really hard...and also extremely fun.

I'm brand new to the guilty gear franchise but I'm definitely having fun with the newest release of the franchise. I can't say how it compares to the previous iterations but I can say that its definitely well made and well optimized. The load screens in this game are practically non-existent and matchmaking is a breeze. The community is fairly niche from what I can tell so I don't expect it to blow up like street fighter but its much easier to play with friends in comparison to other fighting games.

My favorite part of the game so far has been the online lobby system. The game features lobbies called "player rooms" where you can have up to 8 people join in and play on virtual guilty gear machines. You get to walk around and customize your little avatar and talk to each other while queuing for the machines. I know it sounds silly but it's actually amazing. Most fighting games require you to have a 3rd party application for organizing games with your friends but here you can just hang out in the same lobby and all take turns at your discretion. Its a fantastic feature that makes social interactions between players very easy which is great for a niche fighting game such as this.

As for the gameplay itself, I gotta say, It's really hard. I'm not an expert at fighting games by any means, but I'm having a bit of trouble understanding all the mechanics at hand here. If you're interested in picking this game up, be warned that it has a bit of a learning curve. Be prepared to devote some time to adjust to the gameplay and still lose for quite a while.

With that said, I still think Guilty Gear -Revelator- is absolutely worth the price and I give it a full recommendation

28400323.review:
I remember a long time ago in Guilty Gear X, when the original Robo-Ky was just a palette swap of Ky Kiske.  This one instance was the only time I've ever seen the Guilty Gear series drop in quality.

Later, GGXX reached its apex build with Accent Core.  Our once recolored Robo-Ky was now his own character with unique animations and even his own overhead system.  Ever since the first Robo-Ky there was never a shoto-clone cop-out.

Sure there were some experiments in the GG universe, like Ituska and Guilty Gear 2.  While weird they were still pretty fun.

However, the core Guilty Gear fighting game dropped off the face of the world.  Blazblue sudden sprung up as a "spiritual successor."

While good, Blazblue was not guilty gear.  There were no gunflames, there were no volcanic vipers, there were no clunch instant kills.

Then one day, the first trailer for XRD: sign comes up.

Almost like fighting game jesus, Guilty Gear returned to us with the classic Sol vs. Ky rivalry.  Then a miracle happened.  What we thought was a 2d fighter suddenly changed camera angles and blew our minds.

Here we are, the second installment of GG:XRD - the game that opened the PC to fighters and allowed us to downsample it to over 5k resolution to look like a playable Miyazaki movie that rotates in 3-D (yes you can still downsample the crap out of this version by editing the ini files)

While some people might complain about the price, the quality, time, and effort put into the 6 new characters and all of the balacing is worth every penny.

You can see the effort put in, the painstaking quality of making sure that everything looks good and lines up.  While other fighters might have cheaped out, the GG series has always stood at the apex of quality.

I mean look at the tutorial and all the effort put in to support newcomers, its amazing compared to say SF V, which launched with barely any features.

I don't think team RED will ever drop the ball with GG.  This series deserves to be supported because it is loved by its creator and every iteration is pushed out with an outpour of hardwork and painstaking effort to ensure that it's as perfect as they can get it.  You can feel that just by playing and watching it.

So for the review, it's a Guilty Gear fighting game, of course its going to be good.  It's going to be better than good.

If you are even a minor fan of fighting games, Guilty Gear is the prime experience.  It blows the street fighter games out of the water and at some point in time, deservers to completely overtake SF as the primary fighting exprience and Esport leader for the genre.

Unlike SF, there is never a point in time where all is lost.  You can always turn around a match, with any character, under the worst conditions.  There are more clutch reversals in guilty gear than any other fighter due to how well the systems are designed.

If anything, even if you don't play fighters.  The game is worth having just to push into 5k resolution and drool at the polygons that emulate hand drawn art so well you can't tell the difference.

28389000.review:
[h1]We wanna be crazy[/h1]
A~W~E~S~O~M~E!
Чудесное продолжение любимейшего файтинга наконец-то доступно для ПК :3 Я являюсь большим поклонником этой серии, и мне безумно приятно, что игра продолжает жить и с каждым разом удивляет и радует фанатов.
Если вы ещё не приобщились к нашей семье,  то постараюсь описать вам, почему же мы так любим эту вселенную:

[b]История и персонажи.[/b] В GG она заслуживает оценки 10/10. Сюжетные твисты, скандалы, интриги, расследования. Всё завезли. Каждый персонаж великолепно проработан. Обязательно найдите время посмотреть стори-мод!  Жаль что по игре до сих пор не сняли аниме.  

[b]]Дизайн.[/b] Тут даже нечего говорить, слава мастеру Ishiwatari!

[b]Геймплей.[/b] "Для каждого найдётся место"- все персонажи обладают уникальным стилем боя, так что вы точно не заскучаете! Так же в этой части добавлен упрощённый режим управления, так что если вам тяжело даются сложные комбинации  или просто хотите мэшить по фану-можете смело выбирать его. Press X to win =D 

[b]Оптимизация.[/b]Вот это вообще порадовало очень. На моём 5-летнем ноуте прекрасно идёт. ( в предыдущем Xrde были лаги)
 
[b]Музыка.[/b] Прекрасные композиции от Daisuke Ishiwatari  и  Co. отлично дополняют драйв игры. Let's Rock!
Я могу ещё долго расписывать все плюсы, но пожалуй, остановлюсь  на этом и лишь протяну вам геймпад. 

[i]Here comes daredevil...[/i]

28385568.review:
О, божечки! Даже не знаю с чего начать хвалить игру! Новые (и старые) герои великолепны, особенно Джонни с его чрезмерно-смешным эго. Продолжение сюжета (это то, ради чего я в первую очередь покупал игру) на первый взгляд не хуже предидущей части. Характерный юмор персонажей с прекрасной анимацией лиц заставляет кататься по полу. Особенно хочется выделить новые карты. Раньше как-то не обращал внимания, а в этой части их просто невозможно пропустить: великолепная рисовка, анимация рандомных людишек на заднем фоне не уступает героям, все просто божественно. Также хочу выделить новый метод управления персонажем "stylish". Теперь даже если ты не умеешь играть за какого-нибудь персонажа, а хочется пораздавать за него-просто мэшь кнопки, а компутер сам выберет, какой удар наносить следующим, чтобы получилась комба (да,оказуалеле, но как грится - не нравится-не выбирай режим). 
Единственное, к чему можно придраться, так это к тому, что солидную часть игры мы уже имели в xrd за 400 рублей, а сейчас предлагают купить за 1000 рублей тот же xrd + новых персонажей, новую сюжетку, новые арты и рыбалку (дада, теперь можно рыбачить не отходя от компуктера и даже не закрывая любимую игру). Как бы тебе, читатель, выбирать, стоит ли это таких денег, но от себя могу сказать, что стоит.
Подводя итог, хочу сказать спасибо разработчикам. Это один из лучших файтингов, хоть и не самый популярный. Спасибо за то, что не сливаете проект как делают сейчас с мортал комбатами, а совершенствуете и держите планку. Я люблю эту игру, я вырос на ней, и я всячески хочу, чтобы франшиза жила вечно.

28382961.review:
能够在发售这么短的时间内玩到这款游戏，我感到非常的开心。
不过因为太过热情，碰到了一个乌龙事件，在有20%折扣的情况下多花了钱买了全价的游戏。
就懒得退了，实在是太过喜欢这款游戏。

很高兴的看到PC版的运行有了一定的优化，整体效果非常好，新的角色配色也很抢眼。
有23个可用角色，足够在未来的1年中演绎出无数精彩的对战了。
希望这个游戏可以普及，如果有兴趣与中国玩家交流，请加入中国最大的PC GGXX QQ交流群：481494574

期待和你约战到天亮！

本次的新角色个性比较鲜明，并且降低了一定的使用难度，
配合友好的教学系统和挑战模式，可以让没接触过游戏的玩家能够迅速的掌握游戏的系统与角色技巧，
并且有针对性的实战训练模式，只要经过基础的锻炼，就能够了解游戏中一些对战技巧，投入实战。

华丽的画面多变的技能配合良好的平衡性，
这是一款格斗游戏的巅峰巨作，拥有2D（指玩法）格斗最佳的对战体验，
值得每一个玩家去尝试。

富有深度的游戏系统，可以让个人的战斗风格有充分的发挥，
是使用风险大回报高的冲锋战术，还是采用稳重稳健的迂回战术，
都取决于玩家的选择，
游戏鼓励进攻，对彻底的龟派打法有比较明确的惩罚机制，
对战节奏比较快捷明了，过程紧张刺激，
无论是否体验过这种华丽风格的格斗游戏的玩家，都可以在游戏中找到乐趣。

游戏的人物设定极其出色，在精美的人设下，配合每个角色极具个性化的战斗模式，
搭配出完美的角色设计感觉，操作每个角色都能有崭新的游戏体验，
从角色设计的角度出发，这款游戏拥有格斗游戏的顶级设计。
无论是传统型的波动升龙，还是你从未体会过的1控2分身操作角色，
更夸张的还有类似即时战略打法的运营类角色，
无论你喜欢什么样的类型，总能在游戏中找到让你倾心的角色。
选择你喜爱的角色去练习，并打败对手，会享受到更多的快乐。

游戏的联机优化已经有了不错的效果，在中国大陆范围内的对战已经比较流畅，
并且可以在联机状态下完成一些高难度的复杂操作，
基本不会因为网络问题导致没有对战机会，
担心网络问题的玩家可以购买后尝试联机效果再决定是否保留游戏。

这款游戏值得推广，无论你是否喜爱或接触过格斗游戏，它都值得你去尝试。
也欢迎玩家加入中国最大的PC GGXX QQ交流群：481494574
有大量玩家在这里约战。

28382163.review:
Smooth, responsive and well paced combat with fluid combos and a good "buildup-meter" system, great animations (sometimes this game feels like an interactive anime - especially some of the finishers are great and very immersive!) and a great pool of intereseting characters make Guilty Gear Xrd - REVELATOR- probably the best fighting game out there. Its easy to get in but hard to master - as it should be. Pretty much all the traditional modes (training, arcade, story, multiplayer and more) of a fighter are available and there are tons of splasharts, audio, movies etc. to unlock and sink time in. 

This is a "no doubt" recommendation, even with the heavy pricetag, as long as you are a fan of fighting games and/or anime-esque stuff. 

P.S. --Played a couple of hours on console prior to the steam release--

28381217.review:
Note: I owned this on PS3 when it came out.

Checked this out before getting some rest to see if it would run on this computer and if it was still the same as what you get on the console versions few months back.  Everything checks out. Even added the figurine mode where you can set up a little table of figurines of the characters, changing poses and all matter of things about them.

This version currently doesn't have the large lobbies but you can still get into multiplayer rooms, those are still there from what I read on the forums.

The minimum to run this game is a bit off, though. I could run SIGN with a Radeon HD 6900 series and can run this game as well with it without any problems. Even the anime and cutscenes work without a hitch.  So keep that in mind.

I'm extremely pleased this finally came to PC and happier to know that just like with SIGN, they built the game from the ground up to play on computers so this isn't some direct from console port.

...now to make some time to sink into this game again. :D

另外这里说下16：10分辨率全屏显示问题
我用的22寸1680X1050分辨率的显示器， 全屏显示画面会被拉伸，分辨率强制为： 1366 x 768 ，

解决方法：
进入(System drive):\Program Files (x86)\Steam\steamapps\common\GUILTY GEAR Xrd -REVELATOR-\REDGame\Config
这个目录
找到REDSystemSettings这个文件，并用文本编辑器打开
首先找到fullscreen 这个字段，将值设置为True
然后下拉找到下面两个字段，将值设置为你的屏幕分辨率大小
ResX=1680
ResY=1050
这样，保存，退出

希望能在下次更新中解决这个BUG。

28368128.review:
I'm fairly returning player to the fighting games genre, playing daily for an hour or 3. I've been told that Guilty Gear games have a great tutorial that makes everything pale in comparison.

They weren't joking.

Yes, I'm aware that this review for now is going to be me gushing over the tutorial mode, but I wasn't expecting to be that basic and engaging at the same time. For example, you navigate from the left side of the screen to the right as you dodge traps on the ground and floating flames. To learn combos you get monsters that have comic-book style clouds that have a letter inside that corresponds to the button you need to press next (Punch - Kick - Slash - Heavy Slash - Dust). And that's just scratching the surface, because I haven't even read the in-game FAQ to pick a character (the FAQ suggests Sol or Ky if you're new to the game so I'll go with one of them).

Can't believe that I've spent an hour learning the basics of the game in an effective and fun way.

I will be updating my review the more I dive into this game, but rest assured that it's a great fighting game to get into fighting games. My only fear is that Steam's online matchmaking will feel deserted in a week or two, because the game doesn't have cross-platform matchmaking. I hope that finding people through communities and chatrooms (Reddit, Discord) to practice with will suffice.

(And if you're new and from EU feel free to add me).

28364697.review:
First things first, I am a USF4 fan who started watching and playing in 2013. I absolutely loved the scene but barely played the game because I had never played a fighting game before. I have been playing now for about two years leading into the release of SFV. I expected and hoped for a decent game release and maybe some nice suprises with good content or menus or gameflow or something. It had none of these and continues to have none of these up to the release of season 2.

I bought this game on steam release and I have been on it for 2 hours. So far it has made me question the legitimacy of Capcom(SFV's creator) even being a company. If you have made it this far, I apologize for ranting about a different game, but I think it is important perspective for others looking for perspectives and information.

I will now list all of the things I have seen in 2 hours that have been ridiculously impressive(a lot of this stuff I am basically comparing to SFV).
1. The menus: extremely concise and impressive layout and organization along with intuitive design.
2. The flow of menus: going from menu to menu and into games is really fast and smooth.
3. The characters: very interesting cast with unique designs; this is actually very very impressive and is basically the core of the game.
4. The TUTORIALS and other single player modes:  THIS IS SO GOOD, WHOEVER MADE THIS STUFF deserves a medal.
5. LOBBIES: oh my god I actually can't beleive how good this is... the amount of community and growth that can happen in just these lobbies with free chat, controllable little avatars, and cute emotes along with being able to kick a soccer ball around; this is all just so FUN. I never imagined I would say this but... the lobbies are FUN.
6. Okay I kind of give up maybe I'll come back and finish this later but I can't find one thing SFV even has CLOSE to this game in terms of depth or design...

At this point I am going to give this game a chance just from the sheer impressive work that has been put into this game. It is now time to experiment and have fun!

28363487.review:
At least it comes to PC! 

GGxRD - Revelator can be seen as a *very important* upgrade of Sign providing a more "balanced" meta. 
But, for me, this is the best fighting game since a while, despite that some players can be reluctant to the "gatling" combo style.

For people wondering its accessibility, GGxRD-R is still loyal to its creed: "Easy to play, hard to master". 
You'll only need a couple of hours to understand and enjoy nearly all the game mechanisms! But the deeper you wanna go, the more time consuming the game becomes. Try it yourself, you will see the overall quality and depth! And now with 23 playable characters with *unique* gameplay, the roster is more than decent. 

Regarding online mode, there are really good players on GG licence, and thus, it is hard to come as a "newbie". BUT, take a tour to the lab, learn some matchup, and you'll made a lot of progress in few time :)


Moreover, the training section bears a special mention. It is just amazing how Arc System revisited the classical training (when fighting games deign to implement one...) to bring a lot of fun and interactivity in it. So far the best training that I've encountered.

Plus the story, the 3D cell-animation anime like, the musics, the diversity of gameplays... Well, this is definitely a must have !

LET'S ROCK !

28362855.review:
--Pros and Cons review - Ends at recommend for the most part--

This fighting game has great mechanics, great action, a great story mode with a great story and a great cell shaded look. I own this game for PS4, both hard copy and digital, I love the game. I highly recommend it to everyone who hasn't got a PS4 copy of the game.

Getting into Guilty Gear is very, very hard as there are extremely good players out there who's ready to kick your ass 24/7. :D But hit the lab and you'll be seeing improvements, for sure.

This game has so much great content and is executed really well. You can't go wrong with Guilty Gear, ofc. if you like "air dashing", cause that's in here. It's a very combo heavy and fast game and it's done really well and very stylish. You'll get your moneys worth, no doubt.

Now to the negatives, as I own the game already on PS4, I know how it looks on there, I know it has 1080p as max resolution. One of the things that sells a game to me on PC, is the option for higher resolutions, especially a belated release. I have a gfx card that can run this on at least 1440p@60. The game doesn't support an internal render resolution higher than 1080p.

What you get in this release is:
The option for PS4 resolution, max.
4 sliders in your graphics settings for some post processing.

That's it. That's legit it. It's not enough to justify the price to me. No, no.

For everyone who wants to try Guilty Gear, this is the best iteration out there, I highly recommend it.

For you who already own the PS4 copy, don't waste your time if you think this edition is going to bring anything new to the table, - cause it really won't.

P.S.: Ofc. you can run gedosato and hack the internal renderer, but that's really not what the issue is here. The issue is that you're paying 66% extra on top of what you would atm. on PSN, and you are NOT getting anything different.

39509888.review:
Fighting games have always been really alien to me, and I've never really been able to penetrate that barrier to entry. Guilty Gear has been the first fighter to keep me engaged, and the tutorials on offer are so robust that I feel the knowledge gleaned can be easily transferred to other games in the genre. The roster feels very diverse, both in terms of visual design and play styles. 

There are some really interesting mechanics which I haven't really seen in other fighting games (AI summons, resource management, etc.), which makes me really interested to know how balanced these systems can truely be (as said, I'm a complete novice, but I think the community generally regards GG as a well balanced game, so kudos to Arc for pulling this diversity off). 

If you've been wanting to learn fighting games but were always intimadated by the learning curve required, I would absolutely recommend Guilt Gear Xrd as a place to start. Should also go without saying; you'll probably want a controller (or fight stick) to play. Been using a Duelshock 4 which works seamlessly.

39508892.review:
The most complete and fleshed-out fighting game in recent memory. You can get literally everything the game offers for $60 dollars. It seems a lot for a game released 2 years ago, but the amount of content you get from those $60 dollars makes it well worth the money spent.
[h1] Modes [/h1]
[b] Guilty Gear's mode selection is pretty standard when it comes to fighting games, but worth mentioning nonetheless [/b]
[list]
[*]Ranked/casual matchmaking, as well as the ability to create private/custom rooms
[*]Story mode
[*]Bot matches
[*]Powerup mode
[/list]

[h1] Character choice [/h1]
[b] Guilty Gear gives a lot of room to let you play the way you want. There's a lot of characters, so you'll be bound to find one that fits your style. [/b]
[list]
[*]25 mechanically unique characters, 23+ colors each, more colors unlockable
[*]Customizable control scheme for specific characters
[*]2 control types to fit with simpler or more technical players 
[/list] 

[h1] Tutorial Sets[/h1]
[b] One the best tutorial systems I've played through in a fighting game. ASW really know how their game works, Guilty Gear really helps you get familiar with the game's mechanics with pages of trials you can complete. [/b]
[list]
[*] Basics (moving, dashing, blocking, attacking, etc.)
[*] Character specific tutorials (special moves and combo guides)
[*] Practical knowledge (What to do in specific situations)
[*] Character matchup tutorials (How to beat your opponent character's tools)
[/list]

[h1] Training mode [/h1]
[b] Better than most fighting game training modes [/b]
[list]
[*] Input display
[*] Training dummy record/replay
[*] Save states
[*] Fully customizable training dummy
[/list]
[h1] Lore [/h1]
[b] Guilty Gear's lore extends beyond just the story mode and character-specific voice lines. [/b]
[list] 
[*]4-5 hour story movie
[*]Lore encyclopedia
[/list]

[h1] Extras [/h1]
[b] Other goodies that features that come with the game [/b]
[list]
[*]Automatic replays of past matches
[*]Collection of concept art, avatar pictures, voice lines, interviews from VA's, trailers, and music from past games. All unlockable with cash you get from completing tutorials and story modes.
[*] Unlockable character trophies
[*] Fishing mode (similar to Melee's gachapon machine)
[/list]

All in all a very solid package for the $60 I paid for.
